Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and really great location”
Reviews.Author: Gray-Plymouth
Reviews.Content: I was on a work visit to London and spent one night at the London Euston Travelodge. Having stayed in a number of different London Travelodge's (some were not great!) I was not sure what to expect. However this was the BEST travelodge I have ever stayed in in London. It was very clean, tidy and the room was excellent. The room was a decent size bearing in mind it was just for me and on the first floor. The bathroom was spotless and the shower, etc all worked perfectly. The bed was very comfortable. No complaints at all. The hotel is very close to Euston Station so as you might expect there was some noise outside from the buses, etc that passed by, however this didnt affect my stay at all. The beauty of being so close to Euston Station meant that travel to and from this hotel is easy peasy. The location near to the Euston Road means that its ideal for anyone wanting to visit the British Library and other local amenities. I would highly recommend this hotel as a place to stay on visits to London and I will definitely book this hotel to stay at on future London visits for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Staff - Basic Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Chorltonlad
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at the Ibis the other side of Euston Station but for various reasons on this (work) visit to London I didn't. The welcome from the staff on reception was lovely. Quick service and very chatty and welcoming. The rooms are clean, v.basic but fine for a short stay. TV worked ok, shower OK, bed OK. Didn't use any hotel facilities as was just literally sleeping there (i.e.. checked in at 8pm out at 7 am). So can't comment on bar?breakfast etc. Bit steep price wise at £109 but it is central London. I do think the £19 a night advert is a bit of a joke to be honest but I didn't have any complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Decent basic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ColinGJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within a couple of minutes walk of Euston station. It is a fairly new building, but it is already looking a little tired. However, the place was clean. I had a room at the back of the hotel. This was decent, of good size, and seemed fairly quiet. I felt that it was good value for money but I did book around three months in advance which helped in getting a reasonable price. Breakfast was reasonable, with both hot and cold food available. Overall, a decent, basic place to stay in a good central location.

Reviews.Title: “Close, convenient, choice”
Reviews.Author: JJSWWales_UK
Reviews.Content: For travellers in and out of London, particularly those who use Euston Station, this is an ideal hotel. On the doorstep of the station and in the heart of London, Tottenham Court Road is a 5 minute walk away and Camden Town can be reached within 20 minutes. Restaurants, bars and nightlife are all here. The hotel is clean, pleasantly decorated, warm and comfortable. Staff are polite and make check-in and Checkout processes very easy. Having spent a couple of nights in the hotel very recently it has just become my favoured venue of future stays that require me to be within walking distance of central London meetings.

Reviews.Title: “room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: AJD_8
Reviews.Content: The good: Brilliant for Euston station and the underground ( a minute away - you can see the station). Rooms were basic and ours were clean. The shower worked and was hot. The bad: rotten mattress - i woke with a sore shoulder due to a battle with a rogue spring. The noise - the outside rooms are very noisy - I took earplugs which helped. The inside facing rooms are much quieter. There is no left luggage so you either hope to do an early check in (Â£10) or go to left luggage at the station. The pillows are wafer thin and you get one. (Although I note my daughters' room had a spare on a shelf). The mixed: The staff were friendly but their IT system seemed to be lacking and got the better of them.

Reviews.Title: “Cheerful and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Wandering_Viking
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the Euston Travelodge. I found the staff friendly and helpful, both in person and on the phone. I stayed in a room at the back of the hotel, which was remarkably quiet considering the proximity of Euston station. The room was clean and reasonably spacious and the carpet appeared to be new. The mattress unfortunately managed to be both soft and lumpy at the same time and the pillows barely merited the name, making a good night's sleep an impossibility, but as I have encountered similar problems with bedding at other Travelodges, it didn't seem worth complaining. The bathroom was small but well-appointed and clean. WiFi charges in the room are reasonable, and WiFi is actually free in the hotel's bar.

Reviews.Title: “inexpensive, but noisy and rubbish mattress”
Reviews.Author: mac094
Reviews.Content: Stayed here, mainly because it was inexpensive and close to Kings Cross. Room was clean, and location is really convenient, but the noise from outside was non-stop and sleep depriving! Fair enough that the noise, from cars and streets, is outside the hotels control, but the noise insulation from walls and windows was pretty rubbish and made the problem worse. In additon, contrary to other stays in Travelodges, the double mattress was old with us both falling towards an unsupported centre of bed

Reviews.Title: “Not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: timmstwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night before catching the eurostar. I usually go for travelodge when I want good clean comfortable accommodation that is cheap. The hotel only managed to fulfill one of my criteria, it was cheap enough, but that was were the usual comparisons ended. It was not a clean hotel nor was our room comfortable, the bed linen was grubby, when I sat on the bed my bum was nearly touching the floor it sagged so much! The cleanliness of the bathroom left much to be desired and the staff were rude when I asked for an extra pillow, saying they didnt have any! I requested a quiet room as we had an early start, granted it is difficult in London to give you a quiet room but our room was on the first floor, opposite the bus and train station, and the door to the lift so quiet it definately was not. I would think twice before staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Wrong Room”
Reviews.Author: Bolade O
Reviews.Content: Booked a family room online arrived on Sunday the 22nd of January after an 18 hour journey. Checked into a room, settled, went down to reception to ask, was that a family room? No it wasn't! Can it be switched? No it can't! Wait for the manager the next day. Waited for the manager next day, manager didn't show. Reception suggests on line complaint. which I made only on departure. Response sorry, nothing we can do, we don;t make distinctions on room types, we give you any room that we deem suitable for you. Some certain numbers come to mind....4-1-9!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: oxosarahoxo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of August 2011 with my boyfriend for 2 nights. We got a very good deal through superbreak and having spoken to people who have stayed here before, decided on this one. It is about a 5 minute walk from Kings Cross station and directly opposite Euston station and underground (although we didnt use this underground station, as there was more lines from kings cross) there are a few pubs and restaurants around the area although we didnt use any. Rooms were quite small, but the bed was comfy and shower was nice. Don't really need a big room when you're only sleeping/bathing in it. We were located on the ground floor opposite the main road, so for the first night I didnt sleep very well as it is on the main bus route, but the second night, being so tired from walking round london all day, I slept ok. If we stayed again I would maybe ask for a room higher up, or on the opposite side if there are any available. Staff were pleasant and rooms were clean.One downside of the hotel was that there was no left luggage service at the hotel so we had to pay Â£8 to leave it at kings cross. Overall, clean hotel, good value for money and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: BromsgroveBlue
Reviews.Content: Paid Â£25 for the night, ok the rooms are basic but clean and tidy. The room (30) was on the ground floor at the back of the hotel , so was quiet. Self service check in and card drop off on exit meant never actually spoke to anyone with regard to this stay as booked on the Internet - a sign of the future !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Every expense spared”
Reviews.Author: Steve-CH
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on the price of this hotel, combined with good rail ticket prices to make a cheap theatre break. The hotel location couldn't be better, just over the road from the station. We avoided the reception queue by using the self check in machine. Train to room door in about 15 minutes. The room itself was small and quiet (on the third floor), clean, shower only, no bath and only one chair. It soon became apparent how they keep their costs down: One hand towel & one bath towel. We had to go down & queue at reception for more, which were removed by housekeeping the next morning. (We were staying for three nights). No remote for the television. Reception had no spares. Three pillows. None left at reception. Thank you to the kind gentleman in room 207 who let us have his spare as he was on his own. The most uncomforable bed I have ever slept in, like sleeping in a double hammock. We had to cling to the edges to stop rolling into the middle and getiing stuck. We had pre paid for breakfast. Don't bother. Scrambled eggs only and orange juice that tastes like dilute orange squash. By all means try it, but I think you'll find better across the road in the station. I would go back, but only at rock bottom rates. If I had to pay higher prices, I'd find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Found it perfectly OK”
Reviews.Author: jdboyd
Reviews.Content: (repeated review, because I mistakenly sent the other one not under same name as the previous ones - sorry!) A place to lay one's head, as opposed to a welcoming hotel, but our experience certainly was not of the dire kind, and the location of this place, adjacent to the transport hub that is Euston Station, is just great Travelodge IMHO could make very much more of this well-situated place - eg, why ever should they lock up the bar lounge after breakfast and close it at 11pm or sooner?? - why not make this (fairly dismal, underground) area appealing for all-day visitors instead? Another mild complaint is their refusal to store guests' luggage - an absolute pain, and something which other nearby hotels seem to manage OK - aoids paying Â£8.50 PER ITEM to the robber barons of Euston Station Left Luggage

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Handy Location”
Reviews.Author: CumbriaTone
Reviews.Content: My stay at this Travelodge left me with a sense of great satisfaction, that I had neither been ripped off nor had I suffered in any way. The reception was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and although basic, had all the usual things one really needs. There was no traffic noise, good working thermostatic heating and a/c for the summer. I like two pillows when sleeping and there was only one set of bath towels but reception were only too happy to provide extras. We had their buffet breakfast on the two days stay and it was a good breakfast too. The location, immediately adjacent to Euston Station, made the hotel ideal for easy acces to buses, taxis and the tube. I ordered a taxi from the hotel's red phone in reception but don't make my mistake, as a private car arrived and we were charged a fixed rate to Covent Garden for Â£15. A black cab would have been Â£10 including a tip. I will certainly use this hotel again when visiting London. Cost was only Â£92.50 for the two night's stay. We were in room 132 which is a long way along the corridor but well away from the lifts. This hotel will not disappoint he seasoned traveller.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back if in the area on business again”
Reviews.Author: Julesd76
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off ....... My room was clean, travel lodge standard so you know what you are getting, not to noisy bearing in mind you are in central London you'll hear a few sirens etc now and then. Breakfast was fine I didn't have anything from cooked selection so can't comment but plenty if breads, pastries, yoghurts, fruits etc. good value in a central location!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly OK”
Reviews.Author: oncebubbles
Reviews.Content: A place to lay one's head, as opposed to a welcomming hotel, but our experience certainly was not of the dire kind, and the location of this place, adjacent to the transport hub tht is Euston Station, is just great Travelodge IMHO could make very much more of this well-situated place - eg, why ever should they shut the bar lounge at 11am and at 11pm or sooner?? - why not make this (fairly dismal, underground) area appealing for all-day visitors instead? Another mild complaint is their refusal to store guests' luggage - an absolute pain, and something whic all nearby hotels seem to manage OK - aoids paying Â£8.50 PER ITEM to the robber barons of Euston Station Left Luggage

Reviews.Title: “Convenient cheap and clean!”
Reviews.Author: Tag1969
Reviews.Content: This was an ideal place for us to stay being close to Euston tube giving great access to all the places we wanted to visit. Check in was fast (used express machine and had room key within a couple of minutes) room was clean and comfortable with no frills, as expected. Everything worked and had tea and coffee so we were happy. We were towards the rear of the building on the 3rd floor so it was quiet. I would ask for this when you book. We didnt eat there at all so cant comment on that but my daughter grabbed a coffee from the machine in reception on the way out. Quite expensive but handy. Check out was a doddle just put key in the box on way out! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Dear”
Reviews.Author: MartinWhitstable
Reviews.Content: I don't expect miracles from bargain accommodation, great at Â£15 to Â£20 but when the start smacking on New Years Eve premiums, it looks poor value. Room was OK, pillows were really poor, although we did get more from reception. Bed certainly showing signs of wear and now not that comfortable. Reception reasonable but a cheery smile and welcome doesn't cost anything. Breakfast, although reasonable value, why do they have to spoil it with silly ideas. Watering down orange juice to the point of oblivion is just plain mean and why, oh why, do we have to have a large screen TV blaring out football at breakfast. I'm good at rising early and found it objectionable, how those who don't like mornings cope I do not know. Use it, if you can get a bargain and have breakfast at Euston station.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service Spoiled in Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: andybret
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Travelodge, with my partner for New year's Eve. We were basically pleased with the service, but it was spoiled in the restaurant, by obviously very watered down orange juice, but mostly by a television blaring out football for all of our meal. In spite of what we are led to believe, not everyone in this country worships at the shrines of this phoney idol. Certainly, not many of those in the restaurant seemed interested. One more complaint, why is it so difficult to send an email of complaint directly to Travelodge, which is why I am making my complaint here. Don't they want to know what there customers are dissatisfied with? Andy Kent

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, basic, good location for rail stations”
Reviews.Author: rockhopper25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel New Years Eve, the staff were very friendly on our arrival we were checked in easily no problems. We had a double room which was the typical Travelodge room basic no frills, once again just a pet hate of mine a double room has 2 people so why is there only 3 pillows I always have to ask for another one. Excellent location for all the train stations just over road from Euston and about 5 minutes to Kings Cross/ St Pancras. Breakfast was terrible though, eggs smelt of kippers, orange juice was just water with a bit of orange in it, We couldnt drink it. Bed was too soft and very lumpy Otherwise this is a reasonable hotel if you just want a base to sightsee its a perfect location for underground. If you would like to contact me please feel free plus please click the helpfull button if you thought this review has helped you.

Reviews.Title: “Just the job”
Reviews.Author: IKH69
Reviews.Content: Checked in automatically at 10.30pm. Room was clean and tidy. Bar was reasonably priced with some good deals. Worth paying for the breakfast as it was good, fresh and plentiful. Perect for a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: kathrynjc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with two colleagues as were attending a work do in Bloomsbury. The location of the hotel was brilliant and having stayed in some very bad ones I was pleasantly surprised. Our room was huge, there was a fladtscreen TV and plenty of towels and bedding for all of us. Didn't notice any traffic noise but then we were out for the night and slept pretty soundly when we got back. I don't know if we were just lucky with our room but I would definitely stay here again. We paid Â£79 for a family room on a Friday during the Christmas period - really can't argue with that.

Reviews.Title: “It's a travelodge”
Reviews.Author: dsmetcalfe
Reviews.Content: It's a travelodge. Reception efficient, room clean and basically equipped. Breakfast was a full English with not much choice but everything done ok. Great location for British Museum, Library, stations to the North (if you must), etc, etc. If you can get a cheap deal then good no-frills value. Rooms a little noisy at night but then, this is London...

Reviews.Title: “Poor experience”
Reviews.Author: paula048
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in London we went straight to the hotel, first impression of foyer rather dreary. We asked what time we would be able to access our room, were told if we wanted to get into the room before 3pm we would have to pay Â£10 extra (we had already paid Â£100+ for the room), We then asked if we could wait in the restaurant, only to be told that it had just shut. We asked if we could use the toilet and were told it was out of order! Altogether a less than welcoming experience. When we did get into the room, finally, it was reasonably clean but very small, bathroom with shower only, no bath. Breakfast was good value, the best thing about our stay. For light sleepers, note that there is a lot of traffic noise, sirens, etc.

Reviews.Title: “1st time at a Travelodge - probably my last”
Reviews.Author: mjlsll
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Travelodge on Sat 10th, as it was about the only place under Â£100, and my preferred option - PremInn - was in excess of Â£150. I'll probably pay the difference next time. Small room, uncomfortable mattress, awful pillows, very very basic - much as I suppose was expected really. On the plus side, all staff encountered were pleasant and helpful. It is ideally located if you need to be close to Euston, but considering the PremInn is literally across the road, then its a non-starter really. Sorry, just not my cup of tea

Reviews.Title: “Typical Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: butty24
Reviews.Content: Excellent location opposite Euston Station, but this does cause traffic noise. The first room I was given was ground floor on the main road and very very noisy, but after a quick visit to reception I was moved to an upper floor which soon resolved the issue. Public areas were not the cleanest, the carpets didn't seem to have been vacumed for a few days, however the room was spotlessly clean with the exception that the towels hadn't been changed. however another visit to reception quickly rectified the issue. Suprisingly for London the staff were very friendly and nothing appeared to be too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Not like other Travelodges!”
Reviews.Author: matilda50
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently placed for Euston and St Pancras which is why we chose it. The staff seemed helpful and our room was clean but the rooms are not like other Travelodges we've stayed in. They're much smaller and rather cramped. The major complaint we had was the noise. The sound proofing was non existent and the double glazed windows didn't keep any traffic noise out at all (it was almost as if the windows were open!).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & Practical”
Reviews.Author: mark p
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally suited to those arriving at Euston station and is literally on the doorstep being less than a minute's walk away. The rooms are basic but very clean and tidy; I had one of the internal rooms that faced the gardens (the view is blocked by privacy blinds) and it was surprisingly quiet, which was a pleasent surprise because this area of London can be very noisy. The breakfast was simple fare but it was adequate and it is 'help yourself' buffet syle so you can have as little or as much as you like. There is no parking at the hotel but this is typical of most hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “pillows”
Reviews.Author: koalajane
Reviews.Content: I would feel a lot happier about staying in this hotel and other travelodges if they supplied 2 pillows for each guest and your chair in the room was not a plastic bucket chair. We stayed for a night here before using Eurostar the next day, so did not have breakfast. we arrived about 9 pm and it was easy to book in. We left our cases in the room, noting that we needed to ask for 2 more pillows (one each) when we returned form eating out. When we returned we asked for more pillows and was told they had no more but could give us extra towels to use!!! Another guest asked for more pillows and was told the same. Why do they not have enough pillows!!! I notice they say to use the internet in the comfort of your room, which I wonder how comfortable you can be in that chair!!! The room was clean but there was a strange smell. We did not find it too noisy at night as room was at back of travelodge. On the way back we stayed at Premier Inn across the road which was more comfortable and had 2 pillows each!!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Megron
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on business in November. Check in was a bit of a faff....... arrived at 2.55pm and was barked at that unless I stood and waited I woud be charged Â£10 to check in early so "I will be back in 6 mins to let you check in for free" hmmmm ok!!! Check in was very smooth to be honest but got to my room on the second floor to be met with my heating up full blast and this was when the temp outside was 15 degrees!! luckily could then change it to air-con as window was screwed shut. 2 Lifts in hotel and one of these when down on my first night there and was still out of order when I left which made for long waits as more than often housekeeping held the lift at a certain floor!! Breakfast was ok as most people on the run and there was a good variety - free WIFI in bar area which was great!!! I would stay here again if on business but wouldn't take my children here if we were in London.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: ABIR27_11
Reviews.Content: Spent a single night here (29.11.11) - booked through company. Staff The few staff I saw were friendly and helpful. Room It was booked as a family room (Â£99 for night) but neither myself or my colleague were allocated a family room. We checked in just after 4.30pm and it was evident that the room had just been cleaned. The carpet was damp (perhaps mopped) and there was a very unpleasant musty smell in both rooms, the lift and along the landing. The room and bathroom were small but I had expected that. The worst thing about the room was the invasive road noise. Although the windows are double glazed, this does nothing to lessen the noise from vehicles that lasted until after 3am and started again at 5.30am. The rooms were both odd numbered and on the second floor. Even numbered rooms on the other side of the corridor may have been less noisy. Breakfast Breakfast was not included and we paid extra. It was mediocre and the dining area was in a tiny basement. At one point, more people had arrived than could be seated and they had to wait in the corridor outside. Location Handy for Euston station, bars and places to eat but sadly it is located between two very busy roads which means it is not a peaceful or restful place to stay. Recommend No. There are better more affordable places in the near vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: DAR94
Reviews.Content: If you want luxury at budget prices forget. This is a budget hotel located across the road from Euston station. We were efficiently booked in by courteous staff. The room was basic but clean. Bed ok I have slept in a lot worse in more expensive hotels. TV in room and coffee tea making facilities. Bathroom clean and adequate for our needs. Had breakfast which was probably one of the best value breakfast I have had in a hotel, hot, tasty and plenty of it .Good location for transport to get around London. For the price I would certainly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like a plague”
Reviews.Author: cmsmr2
Reviews.Content: My company booked me in at this hotel. O stayed for four nights in November 2011. This is of course a budget hotel (though my company paid over Â£100/night) and as such I was expecting clean-no frill bed and bath. I got the bed and the bath and I am afraid that's where it stops. 1st room has window into the side street through which all buses out of Euston station routed themselves. Talk about noise. I went straight back to the reception and they changed my room, this time quite and ok. Toilet seat was broken which I asked them to fix the next morning. Came back to the hotel 10:00 in the evening to fid that it was not fixed. I went back to the reception to ask why and the manageress began to argue that we have reported it and itâ€™s really not up to us when the engineer will come to fix the seat. I protested that as paying guest I would expect more effort and her solution was to change my room (3rd room). The new room looked no better but hey I had given up by then. Got into the shower and in less than a minuet water was up to my ankle with the blockage in the shower basin. Back to reception and her solution, you guessed it, to change my room (4th room). Needless to say, all changes managed by myself, carrying cloths on hangers up and down the floors and through the corridors with no offer of help. The 4th room was the worth of them all. So much as that I suggest if you stay at this place you do not complain about anything. 1/5 of the duvet was out of the cover as the cover was to small. Duvet looked old and dirty. Mattress should have been replaced months ago. Bathroom could do with a complete revamp. Carpets were dirty in the corners. I am tired now. Avoid like plague.

Reviews.Title: “For a travelodge - not too bad”
Reviews.Author: CoventryCat
Reviews.Content: had to stay here last minute but wasn't too dissapointed. Rooms are clean and staff friendly. Didn't really see much else as had to work late and leave early but fine to get my head doen for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, noisy and avoid at all cost !!!”
Reviews.Author: MrHonest_11
Reviews.Content: on arrival at the hotel the staff could not find our reservation in the system after much searching they found it on there computer spelt incorrectly, Was booked in for a short weekend break which after a four hour train journey was expecting nice warm clean room what we got was a broken bed dirty sheets and damp carpet. reported fault to reception which was never manned told nothing they could do about bed as it the hotel was overbooked how i dont know ! where given clean sheets and duvet cover and basically told to sort it ourselves. Was hungry ventured down to cramped resturant/bar for evening meal wished we had not bothered reheated microwave curry which for a tenner was disgusting. hotel room overlooked grafton place which is a main bus route which is always noisy until roughly 1:30 in the morning not to mention the firebrigade station situation across the road only 3 call outs on first night 8 in total. for food recommend the Prezzo resturant across the road friendly staff and resonable cost unlike hotel staff. Unless you are as skinny as a beanpole you will never be comfortable using the bathroom AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID Could not have been happier when we left on the sunday morning worse three night stay in london ever !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: Rachel D
Reviews.Content: After arriving in the evening for a one night stay for work commitments met by a rude and unhelpful member of staff. I was given my room key once arriving at the room it did not work, returned to recpetion, had the same issue again on the third trip to recpetion I was given another room key, once I got into the room, I discovered it was someone elses room (luckly they were not in the room at the time - or in bed) I then returned again to reception who continued to be unhelpful. I finally got another room and key, I was expecting some external noise after reading reviews and the location, however spent most the night wondering if someone was about to come into the room. Cheap and know what you are getting with travelodge I can accept - but think this is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Clean but Noisey means no sleep”
Reviews.Author: Ash3149
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night due to its location to the train station so we could travel home.... The rooms ate basic but clean, the biggest problem with this building is the noise. There is a fire station and major bus route outside, and whenever a bus waits at the lights (3-5mins) the noise is so loud even the loudest headphones don't block out the sound. The air con didn't work, neither did a lift. Worst night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it claims to do!”
Reviews.Author: BigWoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here ahead of a trip to Paris via Eurostar, and used it as a base to give us an afternoon and evening in London. Having booked some weeks in advance, we had neglected to opt for early check-in, and so feared that we would have to carry our bags around London for the afternoon, having arrived at Kings Cross at about 11.30. We headed to the hotel just in case, and managed to get the last early check-in room - the Â£10 cost being considerably cheaper than the per-bag left luggage costs at either Kings Cross or Euston! The hotel is conveniently located just off Euston Road, in sight of Euston Station, but in easy walking distance of Kings Cross and St Pancras. Check in was reasonably prompt, with very friendly and helpful service, and we headed to our room. It was typical Travelodge fare - nothing special, but clean, comfortable and good value. Having dumped our bags, we headed out to Covent Garden, about 25 minutes walk away, heading back to change before dinner on the Euston Road. Our room was quiet at night, and we all slept well. Because we were having breakfast on Eurostar, we didn't eat at the hotel, and so can't comment on that aspect of the service. However, we were happy with everything about our stay, and would have no hesitation in staying here again should the occasion arise.

Reviews.Title: “has everything you need”
Reviews.Author: aminac
Reviews.Content: Everybody that gave this hotel a bad review should remember that they are staying in a Travelodge. This is a basic hotel, and you won't find any more than a bar of soap for your toiletries, but how often do you actually use a hotel's toiletries? You will find coffee and tea, and a working kettle, shower and TV, and rooms are clean, warm and secure. Again, breakfast is basic, but you will not go away hungry, and there is enough variety there. I stayed for quite a few nights and the staff couldn't be more helpful and accommodating. When air conditioning didn't work in one room, they moved me into another without any problems. Would - and indeed will - stay again!

Reviews.Title: “POOR VALUE”
Reviews.Author: Blackroo
Reviews.Content: We arrived too early to check in, even though the room was ready we had to pay Â£10 to have it early! Receptionist not very friendly at all. Rooms very basic, we booked a family room for 3 and the spare bed not even made up. One flat pillow each and few towels. We stayed for 3 nights, rooms weren't cleaned properly, not hoovered at all whilst we were there, bin not emptied everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: JimmyH79
Reviews.Content: Booked a one night stay to go and see Noel Gallagher near by.Right next to Euston underground and overground stations.We had room 7 on ground floor, small, clean and conveient.Bit of road noise to be expected in London but wasn't a problem.Doric pub over the road was cheap and served amazing food.Staff were helpful and polite.Would recommend if you need a cheap stay with good connections.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value, dirty room”
Reviews.Author: shropshirelass66
Reviews.Content: My two children and I stayed one night here in October. We only stayed as we had got a good package from Hotels.com for three nights at the Marriott Marble Arch and needed an extra night. We arrived at three 0'clock and our room was ready. It was on the first floor and as you would expect basic. The one thing that struck me was although the bathroom was really clean, the carpet in the room was dirty, and the spare bed was stained and dirty. We made up the bed and there was hardly room to swing a cat. There were party straws under the spare bed and overall it was filthy. The mattress was covered in dirty stains and the pillows so thin I had a bad neck in the morning. This hotel was only thirty pounds cheaper than the 4* Marriott with a pool, gym, executive lounge and feather duvets. It was dirty and the noise of the traffic loud. We couldn't wait to leave and do NOT recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean, basic and can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: brucebassa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times over the years as it is very convenient being most handy for Euston, King's Cross and St Pancras as well as for travelling around London. I have found it serves this purpose and is ok if all you need is a clean, fairly comfortable ensuite room for a night at a reasonable (for London) cost. I don't think this hotel aspires to offer more than this. It is not somewhere to look forward to staying in. Rooms can vary widely regarding noise, my last stay was noisy but on other occaisons other rooms were quiter. The airconditioning never seems to work anywhere. The Premier Inn nearby is more expensive but a lot more comfortable and a much nicer hotel alround in my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could try harder”
Reviews.Author: algorithmandblues
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in April 2011 while attending a gig. Found the double room to be quite small, especially when compared with similar rooms offered by Premier Inn. The air conditioning did not seem to work and the cushions were poor. First morning's sleep was disturbed by a policeman shouting in at some guests 3 or 4 doors down. Looked like some form of negotiation was going on? On the good side it is conveniently located across the road from Euston tube and was easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Travelodge - incredibly quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Merrowmum
Reviews.Content: Booking a Travelodge, you have to be aware that this will be no-frills accommodation, and I have written this review with that in mind. I stayed here overnight with my husband and two children before travelling on the Eurostar the following morning. Our family room was in the basement and was a good size, with the usual sofa bed plus pull out trundle for the children to sleep on. Our bed was comfortable although the pillows were pretty inadequate! The room and bathroom were both clean and modern. We were amazed how quiet it was - not only could we hear next to nothing from outside, but equally virtually nothing from around us in the hotel either. The blackout blind at the window performed very well so we all had a very good night's sleep. We didn't use the buffet cafe but it was good to see that there was one. Overall, I would definitely use this hotel again when using the Eurostar or travelling from Kings Cross early in the morning (it's about 5 minutes easy walk away) but I don't think I would use it as a base for a London visit.

Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodation but good location”
Reviews.Author: muzzascot
Reviews.Content: As with all Travelodges this is a basic room with not many frills. The room was clean and tidy, the tele was fine, it wasn't too hot or cold and the aircon worked when we wanted it to. Breakfast was buffet style and although limited in choice was fine for the price. One day the room wasn't cleaned but we did have the "do not disturb" note on the door until about 11ish. If you are a light sleeper make sure you ask for a room towards the rear of the hotel as these are much quieter. Note you don't see anything out of the rear windows as there are flats directly opposite.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is...”
Reviews.Author: Christyczynski
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night while in London to go to a gig. I booked in advance and got a room for Â£30. The self check in kiosk was great and saved me waiting in a queue of around 5 other people. The room I was allocated was fine for the 1 night, but there was basically no view from the window which backed onto a wall. Room was clean enough, bed done the job. I was there myself so the 3 flat pillows were enough, but this wouldn't have sufficed had I been sharing. The en suite was clean enough, the shower was hot and good, although i would have liked a bath, and there was enough towels for me. The only complaint I had was the noise through the night. Yes it is in a busy area of London, but the constant noise (police sirens, traffic noise etc) could be cut down by putting in better windows. I was on the 4th floor. I wouldn't like to think what it would be like lower down, but it done the job I needed it to do. I didn't have breakfast as I was leaving on an early train, and used the self check in kiosk, so can't comment on the staff. The only time I spoke to someone was on departure when I was handing back the key card, and the girl seemed jovial enough for early in the morning and asked if everything was ok. Told her about the noise and she said its a common complaint, but she was at least apologetic. I'd stay again, but only for 1 night if the price was similar to what I paid last time.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but a bit noisy!”
Reviews.Author: ASuttonRes
Reviews.Content: We booked this 10mths advance to get a sale room rate. If what you are after is a cheap as chips, no frills, central hotel then this is for you. It is a 2min walk from Euston station. Down side is it is exceptionally noisy at night (being opposite a huge bus stop and round the corner from a station) so I would recommend ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Dan P
Reviews.Content: I was allocated a room on the ground floor on the road side. Checking in at night, the room was not noisy but from about 5am busses past the room and they sounded more like they were in the room! The fast automatic check-in was a good facility and the room itself was in good condition. Unfortunately there was no remote in the room, and reception didnt speak English well but said there were no remotes - you had to stand on the edge of the bed to change the tv channel. I have now stayed at London Faringdon, London Kings Cross Royal Scott and London Docklands and all are as bad as each other. Sadly, its IBIS or Premier Inn in the future as they offer better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best bit is location”
Reviews.Author: Peejdj
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a couple of times now, most recently on business for two nights. Best thing is definitely the location if you are travelling via Euston Station. Standard Travelodge decor inside although better than others I've stayed in due to its relative newness. Clean and tidy but minimalist is the best description. I was on the second floor and had no issues with noise from outside or neighbouring rooms. There were a couple of irritating things. Firstly when I arrived I couldn't get into the room as the key didn't work and so I had to trek back down to reception twice for another key, after eventually discovering there was someone else already in the room they'd allocated me. And the fire alarm went off at 7:30am on Saturday morning which was a pain. Didn't sample the breakfast so can't comment.

Reviews.Title: “Spartan, absolutely no frills whatsoever.”
Reviews.Author: Porteye
Reviews.Content: Think of a modern prison cell: stark. Window you cannot open, no curtains (roller blind only, which only rolls half way up) blank walls except a tv bolted 5 feet up, the angle of which cannot be altered. And tiny, 2 inch thick pillows. No bedside tables. Lights behind bedstead don't work. Bathroom so small that if you breathe in while sitting on toilet, your chest simultaneously digs into roll holder and sink. No bath. Positives: air con; clean. I won't be visiting a travel lodge again; I am certain that for a few pounds more, you can do much much better.

Reviews.Title: “A bit too basic for me!”
Reviews.Author: Somerset-jim
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in a ground floor room - I was not bothered by the noise problems that seem to have affected reviewers. The general cleanliness of the hotel was poor, there is a very odd smell in the corridors - a mixture of paint and cabbage! My room was basic and functional but there was no way to adjust the room temperature and the window did not open. I had breakfast which was OK for Â£7.95 (kids eat free) - I got to breakfast early but the "cafe" was very small and it started to fill up by 07.30 You get what you pay for - unfortunately because it was a late booking and london hotels were very busy - it cost nearly Â£100 for the night. Not a hotel I would visit again unless I had no option

Reviews.Title: “Baking Oven with rude unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 40goingon80
Reviews.Content: Don't bother booking a family room for early check-in for a Â£10 fee, as you will be sorely disappointed. The room was supposed to be ready at 12 noon. We arrived a few minutes after 12 only to be told we would have to wait 10 minutes as the room wasn't ready. When this was disputed, we were informed it was subject to availability, which is not what it says on the room booking confirmation. While we waited in reception for a further 10 minutes waiting for our room, several other people tried to access their family rooms, only to be told that the waiting time was now 30 minutes. We queried this again, tried to get a room elsewhere (almost impossible at lunchtime on a Saturday) and 35 minutes after it should have been ready, we were given our key. The rooms are basic, no question, but clean sheets would have been nice. We struggled to get any interest from anyone the staff, especially when we asked for more towels, bed linen, etc. The air conditioning didn't work. The room was like an oven. The window was locked, so we had to get the key from reception. They said they would send someone to look at it. When we returned, we were told it had been fixed, but it was no different. When we told the receptionist on check out it was the worse stay we'd ever had, he laughed. Won't be going here again. I'd rather sleep on Euston station.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, convenient and very suitable for young family”
Reviews.Author: Travellingwith7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Euston Travelodge early October with 5 children (3,5,7,9,11) so had two rooms. Staff were helpful,although were unable to assist with dietary questions (at breakfast) with the manager absent. Accommodation is consistent with other Travelodges we stayed at - basic, but clean, functional not too cramped. Breakfast (prepaid) turned out to be a real bargain because the children eat free (but it would have been fine for the ~Â£5 prepaid anyway). We had no issues with noise (we probably caused our fair share), but we were downstairs facing the quiet side of the hotel. Overall location, cost and ability to accommodate our large family made for a very successful stay at Travelodge Euston.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: FradamBrown
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of friends. We booked the TL as it's well priced for what we needed from a one night stay. The rooms were as expected, basic but reasonably clean the breakfast however was.........poor by any standards. The choice was ok having some fruit juices, tea and coffee. Sausage, bacon, some kind of egg and ........ Oh this is where we hit the moldy bread, and moldy croissants ! A massive turn off and a rather rude female staff member when this basic faux par was highlighted. A complaint was sent to TL but no response! It left us thinking what else have they overlooked? Maybe this is why 3 of the group were bitten by something leaving them with rather large blotches on their legs and arms! Overall basic, comfy bed but go out for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of a 3 more a 2.5”
Reviews.Author: UkPeteD
Reviews.Content: Plus points - Ok rooms, basic mine but clean enough - Eating facilities and a bar - TV in room - Great location for Euston - Reasonable price Could be better - No hairdryer - No toiletries - Didnt like being in basment - Noisey with church bells ringing!

Reviews.Title: “London Euston- Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Travelmore1261
Reviews.Content: Arrived from North England for an overnight stay in London prior to departure on the Eurostar early the next day. Chose the hotel for its convenience to the train stations and innercity location. Traveling with two older children (12 & 14) found the room to be small and very basic as you would expect but the big issue was the street noise and constant noise of sirens and similar throughout the night. Think the hotel could splurge on some double glazing at the very least. Look for alternatives if location is not an issue!!

Reviews.Title: “Souless & depressing”
Reviews.Author: 44holden
Reviews.Content: We walked in around 4pm to find 20 very loud, drunken football fans also trying to check-in and decided to get around this by using one of the two self service check-in machines which worked fine but, unfortunately you couldn't choose your room. The room the machine auto allocated us was on the 1st floor and frankly stank strongly of body odour. After a trip back to the now quietened reception we were thankfully moved to the 3rd floor facing away from the street. The most positive things mentionable for the room were it was of adequate size and clean. Apart from that, the bed was quite hard and the pillows were just dreadful - thin & hard. We asked for two more pillows and were told we couldn't have any until the next day due to a "laundry problem". The room had no phone which disturbed me thinking of safety - what if someone needed help in their room? I asked reception about this to be abruptly told to use my mobile phone. Hmmmm. Very poor space provided to hang your clothes and be prepared to take your valuables everywhere as there is no room safe. The bathroom got a tick for its cleanliness yet, like the pillows, the towels are cheap and thin. Tea and coffee facilities are of your typical cheap plastic 1 star hotel type and there is no fridge in case you are staying a while and need to keep some milk. Location is just about the only thing it has going for it. Euston station right next door and a two minute walk to one of the hop on-hop off bus tour stops. I strongly recommend not staying here - there are two Premiere Inns within 5 minutes of this place. For about Â£20 per night more you will get everything the Travelodge Euston is lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Dave B
Reviews.Content: This is about the worst hotel I have stayed in and I have stayed in many. Â£159/night while I can accept spartan rooms what I find amazing is to be told they have run out of soap. Surely for this amount I should expect at least a bar of soap.

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a cheap rate, bearable for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: michelle09
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel for someone who wants to relax in the comfort of their room for hours. It is a clean, basic hotel ideal for anyone coming in from Euston which is 2 minutes away. We paid Â£32 for a Sunday night and felt that it was good value. I would not pay the Â£100 I have been quoted before, as the rooms are small compared to other Travelodges, and the Kings Cross hotel is much more pleasant. You are given one thin pillow each, but you can go and ask for extra pillows at reception without any problem. We did not notice too much noise from the railway station. Definitely bearable for a couple of nights at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Not for people who need to breathe!!”
Reviews.Author: petesuzan
Reviews.Content: Staff made me feel awkward from the minute I tried to check in. I arrived at 14:00 on a Friday afternoon only to be told that I had to pay an extra Â£10 in order to check in before 15:00. I explained that I would rather read my paper, have a coffee and wait an hour -the lady looked shocked! There are no chairs to sit on in the reception area so I ended waiting in cafe nero. I tried to check in again at 14:55 only to be told once again that I had to wait for exactly 5 minutes! Ok fair enough maybe it is something to do with their computer check in system, although doubtful. I am a young female traveller and was placed on the ground floor which I didnt appreciate. The first thing that hit me was the nasty overpowering air freshner filling the corridor outside the room. The room was totally stuffy and the window had the handle removed so it could not be opened (this is the case for all rooms). I asked to move rooms and have the window open as my chest didnt feel great after sitting in their for a while (I dont have breathing problems so I can only imagine what this stuffy environment would be like for someone who does). I was given an allen key to open the window but didnt get any sleep that night as I was on the ground floor with people walking directly past the window. Without the blind down completely speople could walk past and look straight in. The bed was medieval my whole body was aching the next day (I have never complained about a hotel bed before). There was no mattress protector and the sheets were thin enough to see the mattress pattern. I will say there were no pillows because a 2cm thick flimsy piece of foam doesnt count as a pillow in my opinion. I didnt bother with breakfast etc I knew I would be disappointed. So overall I was unable to arrive, check in without problems and have good night sleep. Disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Another one bites the dust”
Reviews.Author: dottyredshoes
Reviews.Content: I barely know where to start with this one, so let's aim for something positive as I do like to be fair. Was it clean? Yes Breakfast? Basic, but really nice bacon, well cooked. Anything else? Not really. I gave up on Travelodge a few years ago in despair at the meagre nature of the offering. I accepted this hotel (work booked it for me) because I'd heard that they'd been upgrading and I assumed that with all the competition, e.g. Premier Inn, that they would have upped their game. How wrong I was. My room was a spartan box. I'm struggling even to describe it. How do you describe nothingness? It gave the impression of a place where they are accustomed to having things stolen so that the default position is to strip everything back to the barest of essentials. A bed but no bedside tables. No proper furniture to speak of, just planks screwed into the wall to make a narrow shelf under the mirror which had to serve as dressing table and shelf, the usual open box with a hanging rail ~ and that was it! The towels were thin and meagre. There was no mat to step out on to from the shower. A two inch sliver of soap was the entire provision in the bathroom. Oh yes, there was a little telly, but I had to lie on my side on the bed to be able to see it. My blind did not block out the light, and the noise from the street was a significant irritant. There were holes ~ yes, holes! two of them ~ in my thin duvet cover. I do hate to whinge, but this was not my best stay in the area. If all you want is close proximity to London Euston station, you might actually consider staying here. It wouldn't entice me. There is a better option just around the other side of the station at MIC. If I'd been on one of their Â£19 deals I'd have considered that I probably got what I'd paid for. But at Â£92 I think they could do better, much better. Were I a Martian arriving in London, this would persuade me that the Brits are a mean and miserly lot or that we actually enjoy discomfort. I'm booked for another Travelodge tomorrow so probably too late to change ~ oh dear. Another one bites the dust.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Pete C
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised. Good location. Friendly helpful reception. Clean bathroom and bedroom. Very good breakfast - better than many more expensive hotels. Reasonably quiet considering where it is. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - one to avoid”
Reviews.Author: scott_glasgow_11
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst travelodge I have stayed at - dirty, very noisy, and pretty basic. My first room was ground floor with a broken window that would not close, the second room super noisy. If you get a room relatively well located, serviceable and at one of the very low prices this place may be ok, but at Â£150 per night it most definitely is not.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Zmith
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in a first floor room. Room was an odd shape, door opened straight on to bed, television was mounted on wall beside bed making it difficult to watch. There was a thin section of the room alongside the bathroom that was only useful if you needed to store lots of luggage. Bathroom was spotless, shame the bedroom wasnâ€™t, carpet was dirty and there were bottles left lying under the bed. Bed was very firm and not comfortable, pillows rather flat. Biggest problem was the window which opened in to the room. It blew open every time there was a strong breeze or a lorry drove past, and there was no handle to shut it. Phoned reception to ask if they could lock it â€“ no answer. After 10 minutes (not an exaggeration) ringing the bell at the reception desk someone finally responded and came to lock my room window. Even with it shut the outside noise was unbearable. If you do stay bring earplugs. Breakfast was continental only and was disappointing. I wonâ€™t be staying again. It is cheap for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “Ok , especially for the prce”
Reviews.Author: AndrewandChris
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location right outside Euston station and it is extremely easy to reach all the main sites quickly on either the tube or buses . The room was pretty basic , what you would expect from a Travelodge , but again for the price we paid and it's location excellent value . We had a room on the lower ground floor and unlike other reports we had little noise from outside ... so try and get one of those . Now the bad bit , there was a large rowdy group staying at the hotel and these caused a real nuisance with noise . We asked to move rooms but were told the only other available room was also near other parts of the party so we stayed put . The staff could have been much more efficient in helping to sort out the problem and they seemed pretty disinterested . The bed had also certainly seen better days and was very uncomfortble . All in all if you get a good rate it's ok for one or two nights .

Reviews.Title: “The worst Travelodge I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: flopper53
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here. In a very prime position next to the station. Very noisey the first night/morning bar opened until 5am so lots of noise with people going back to their rooms. Will add that the second night was very quiet. Room 122 was very basic mirror was missing from the wall, there was a leak from a pipe at the back of the toilet. Must say bed was comfortable though plenty of towels, but not impressed with the cleanliness, washbasin hadn't been cleaned after the first morning, cups weren't cleaned or replaced and teabags were not replemished. Will not go back when visiting London

Reviews.Title: “It was ok - good location”
Reviews.Author: ZippySara
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in September 2011. The main draw was the location - my train got in late and I didn't want to be traipsing across the city - it is right next to Euston and about a 5 minute walk from Kings Cross. Euston is well equipped with shops, including an M&S food store so you can grab breakfast there! There is an automatic check in machine which was simple to operate. My double room was on the third floor and on the side street - there was some noise at night but not too much. The rollerblind shut out any light. The room was clean although a few of the fixtures, especially in the bathroom needed fixed or upgraded - eg the bathroom bin had a metal spike sticking out , one of the buttons on the shower was broken and a bedside lamp needed fixed. The bed was reasonably comfortable, and the room was equipped with a kettle and a flatscreen tv on the wall - it was next to the bed so you had to lie across it to see properly. All in all, its fine for a place to lay your head and the location is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “OK for an overnight stop”
Reviews.Author: davidjones533
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for an overnight stop if journeying on the nearby eurostar. The rooms are clean and adequately equipped. However, we found that the window blind does not come completely down, so be prepared to wake at sunrise. The bed was not particularly comfortable, with the mrs and I finding ourselves continually rolling towards the centre. Finally, the shower did not drain properly, leaving very little time to wash before the floor flooded.

Reviews.Title: “Bad start, but got better”
Reviews.Author: bylromarha
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights during Bank Holiday weekend with husband, 7 yr old and 5 yr old. Turned up at 12pm and asked to leave suitcase - told we couldn't unless we bought Â£10 early check in. As cost of leaving the case at Euston Station was Â£8.50, we decided to pay the Â£10. Dumped our bags, off to Notting Hill carnival. Returned to room at 8pm and put kids to bed. At this point we realised just how loud the room was - we had a 2nd floor room overlooking the bus station and main road. Tried to close the window as a wide gap, but no handle. Reception had the allan key to close it, but when staff member came up to close it, he told us the window was already closed. Husband pointed out that you shouldn't be able to slide your fingers between the window frame parts if it was closed. Staff member then tried to fob us off with "the website does state there will be noise as it's a busy location". Husband and I pointed out noise was fine, an open window which cannot be closed is not. Staff member then told us to try it out and he would move room in the morning to the quiet lower ground floor. As it's 9pm by this time, I firmly told him my children would not be able to sleep in that room and that 2 double or twin rooms with a closed window would be preferable if no quiet family room could be found. Having already told us there were no family rooms available in the quiet lower ground area, he went back to reception with me following and, amazingly, a family room in the quiet lower ground floor was available. Think he realised I wasn't going to go away... Both rooms we were in were typical travelodge - bit cramped, lacking a fresh smell, few stains on bedding and surfaces, mouldy grout and peeling paint on bathroom ceiling. Communal areas fresh looking and in a good condition. Avoided the breakfast as overpriced "buffet" didn't seem high quality - M+S and sainsbury is 20 second walk away, so we got pack of croissants and pint of milk each morning, Â£2 for 4 of us. Caffe Nero and several breakfast outlets all 20 second walk away in Euston station. Would return if looking for a cheap sleep, but only if I was guaranteed a room on the lower ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid totally, terrible service and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyHolsgrove
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Bank Holiday Monday 29th Aug 2011 for one night and that was one night too much. I was travelling with a friend who has problems walking and uses walking sticks so we booked a disabled room with twin beds. We had also booked and paid the Â£10 for an early check to save us waiting around. We arrived at the travelodge at 1pm only to be told that our room was not ready and we would have to wait, i tried to explain that we had paid for an early check in only to be told that at this moment it wasnt possible (we were not offered our money back), i tried to explain that my friend could not stand for a long period of time due to diability but the very un helpful receptionist told us there was nothing she could do and we would have to wait. 2 hours later we finally got into our room, i told the receptionist that we would like a late check out the following day, she tried to charge me another Â£10 but i refused to pay saying that we had paid for an early check in which we did not receive so that money can pay for our check out. The room was larger than some previous travelodge we had stayed in but thwe carpet was wet by the bathroom and it hadnt been cleaned properly. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone, for the price we paid we would have expected better

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money - would do it again”
Reviews.Author: Alonholiday
Reviews.Content: 3 night sight seeing trip booked a couple of days before arrival. Looking for economy rather than luxury/views/location. 200 yards from the underground and shops at Euston station. Only 20 minutes from leaving room to, for example, Houses of Parliament. Area felt safe when returning at night. Arrived an hour before official booking in time and receptionist was great; advised on the best room for a quiter sleep and made sure it was ready for occupation. Floors and rooms accessible by card key. Rooms basic, neat and tidy. Bed is only about two steps away from the door/corridor so risk to a good night sleep is from noisy guests. Plenty of places to eat around Euston station but we pre-booked breakfast in the hotel and glad we did. Restaurant served good quality food, plenty of it, relaxing atmosphere, Sky News on the TV and restaurant not overly busy.

Reviews.Title: “Staff attitude needs sorted”
Reviews.Author: chappell1964
Reviews.Content: Went to London for a concert and picked the Travelodge for its convenience to Euston Station, however with not knowing London very well, I found out while there that there were plenty of other places close by I would rather have stayed. We got there at around 13:00 and asked if we could book, neither assistant looked up and asked 'you pay early check in', I replied I hadn't, the reply was (still with their noses at the desk) 'you come back at 3'. OK I said 'is it possible to put this small bag in your storage till we come back' the reply (still with their nose at the desk) 'we do not keep luggage', at this point I made a comment about their attitutde and that I am a paying customer, it was like water off a ducks back. Anyway we found a pub for a couple of hours and went back at 3, only to find one of the assistants greet me when I went and ask would I like to try their self service check in, the other assistant was behind the counter, I said if 'no thanks, I have paid for someone to check me in therefore you can do that simple thing can't you'? Again it was if they didn't understand, probably my northern accent! Went to the room, it was about 12 by 12 including the bathroom (the picture in the brochure did not look like it at all), the TV was on the wall it had no remote so you had to change channnel blind, I asked about a remote but was just looked at blankly, again must have been my accent. The carpets were stained and the windows did not open, the bathroom was a little grimy in areas and hadn't had a thorough clean for some time. The bed was OK, had to get additional pillows as there were only little thin things on the bed when you went in, that was a chore in itself trying to get them. We decided to laugh it off, it was only somewhere to put our heads down for the night. Breakfast was continental style, nothing special but adequate. For a Â£110 in the middle of London I wasn't expecting a lot, but was expecting a little more than this, would not return. If you are going for 1 night and need somewhere to put your head down then it is adequate, not ideal for any longer, the rooms are small, there is limited space for storage, and the rooms are a little stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: val s
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and would definitely stay again. the room was spotlessand it was cleaned every day.There was some traffic noise but that was to be expected due to its very convenient location which is only two minutes from Euston station.the staff that we saw were friendly and although we arrived at 9 in the morning, we were allowed in our rooms which was a big plus for us.We didn't have the breakfast but we found a cheap and cheerful little cafe just down the road run by a nice Italian man who served a full English with toast and a tea or coffee for Â£4.all in all it is good value for money. there are many more good places to eat in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Put me off staying in Travelodges!”
Reviews.Author: teabag80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night to get an early morning eurostar the next day. It started well, the automatic check-in was very quick and the powerful air con in the room was a blessing as it was a very muggy day. However, when we came to use the sink, it was horribly, disgustingly blocked. Water just wouldn't drain out at all and debris from within the plug started flowing back into the sink! Really disgusting. Similarly horrible was the sight of the cup of tea we tried to make, more scum than tea and was undrinkable. The next morning, I went to the reception to get a hairdryer and nobody would come to the desk, despite me ringing the bell several times and could very clearly hear someone moving around in the nearby office. The breakfast fare was good but served in a dingy basement room. We have stayed in Travelodges on a number of occasions and each time, I get a little bit more fed-up of them. I have now vowed not to use them again as they do not represent good value for money in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “APPALLING DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Emma396
Reviews.Content: Didn't get the room we paid for. Room we did get was smelly and air con did not work. Woken up all night by road noise and noise from within hotel, doors banging etc. Staff rude and ignorant, pushed past us out of lift, manager not on site to resolve complaints. Complaint still not resolved, manager never seems to be at work or is too busy to respond to us. Breakfast muffins were mouldy. When told receptionist that we would complaint to head office she laughed and hung up!!!! WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER SEEN!

Reviews.Title: “good location close to Kings Cross”
Reviews.Author: 50something3
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for sight seeing\theatre visit. Room smaller than other travelodges have stayed in, but this was the centre of London. Got a good rate as booked early on an on line offer and pre booked breakfast so good value. Travelled on cheap offer train tickets as well (Â£40 return for two of us from Yorkshire) No left luggage at travelodge, so used left luggage at Kings Cross- made mistake of taking two small bags, but have to pay for each bag. Our room got no noise from outside, bed was comfortable, got extra pillow on request. Shower tray not very deep, so water flooded onto floor,and had to use a towel as bath mat. As requested we left the other towels on rail/bathroom hook as didn't want clean ones for second day, however, we returned to find one set of new towels only. Reception apologised and quickly gave us second set. Didn't spend much time in the place as out after breakfast and only back to freshen up before out for the evening. Bar in basement and was also where you had breakfast. Would recomend for a basic no frills accomodation to travlodge standard, we would return for similar visit in future. We were there during riots, saw no trouble and felt safe walking back to travelodge from St Pancras tube..Found people we met in London friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin... but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: P_Rowberry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge London Euston for 1 night in July 2011 to allow for an early Eurostar connection the next morning. We decided on this particular Travelodge after looking at the other hotels on their website, deciding that this looked the best/most up to date in the area. The location was excellent, yards from London Euston train station and a 10 minute walk from St. Pancras International. There are also lots of pubs and restaurants in the immediate vicinity. Check in was quick and simple and staff were pleasant. The room was basic (but thatâ€™s what you expect from a Travelodge) but clean. The bed wasnâ€™t the comfiest and the room was surprisingly noisy considering that we were 3 floors up on the back of the hotel overlooking a courtyard. It fulfilled our needs but one night was definitely enough... a convenient stop-over point to break up a long journey but nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: wangaijun
Reviews.Content: Location is very convenient, Just one min from the Euston station to here. You can choose this one if you do not want spend too much money. However, the staff is not friendly. Last time, there was a mistake on my booking form. He just left me alone.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient but a little noisy!”
Reviews.Author: MollieMu
Reviews.Content: We chose this particular Travelodge because it was just feet away from Euston Station and we thought an ideal base for a family weekend in London to see the attractions. It was ideally placed and it was great to step off the tube at the end of a very long and tiring day touring the city and step into our hotel, especially when the kids were shattered. It was very handy for groceries for our packed lunches - a Sainsburys and M&S at the station - and there was a great little family friendly pub next door serving food all day. During our stay the weather was extremely hot and it was a disappointment to discover that the air conditioning unit in our room was not working, so we had to leave the window open on both nights to keep cool. As a result ,the noise from the street below was quite loud although it might have been worse if we hadn't have been on the third floor - especially the delivery lorry to the pub right below our window at 8am ! Apart from that, the room was clean, fresh and well stocked wth tea & coffee making facilities, clean towels and bedding and adequately refreshed on our second day. We've used Travelodges before and knew to expect basic but clean accommodation. That's what we got. We did not meet any reception desk staff because we booked online and used the automated check-in. The staff in the very busy breakfast room were helpful and attentive. The best feature of this Travelodge London Euston is its location. If you are easily distracted by street noise it might not be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: telboy1999
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the way back from a holiday in Europe, and were pleasantly surprised. We weren't really sure what to expect with this being a "budget" hotel, but we had no complaints about what we got. Location - very good. Just across the street from Euston station and a few minutes walk away from St Pancras therefore handy for the Eurostar. Check-in - very efficient and easy to use self-service, and the member of staff on duty to assist was very friendly and helpful. No problems. Room - very clean, spacious, well-appointed, thoughtfully laid-out but not luxurious. Just about what you'd expect really. The bed was very comfortable and there were extra pillows provided. The bathroom was basic but nicely decorated, with little in the way of extras but the shower was good and there were plenty of towels. The doube-glazing is very efficient at drowning out any potental noise from the very busy Euston Road just outside. There were a few thoughtful touches too - the weather was particularly hot and sticky that day and management had provided a fan in the room to assist the air conditioning! Breakfast - a buffet-style self-service affair that is very efficiently run. There is plenty of variety on display, and both the hot and cold food items were replenished regularly. Plenty of staff meant that there were no long waits for tables to be cleared and cleaned. The breakfast room manager was very on-the-ball and ensured that everything ran smoothly. All in all, this is a very nice hotel. We had no compaints at all and would be happy to stay here again, either as a stop-over or as a base for a London break.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Texel1745
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on a business trip, had stayed with friends a year or so ago. Check in was fine, quick and no fuss. The room was a good size, spotless and had a good bathroom/shower. The bed was comfortable and once I had coaxed the remote into life the TV was fine. Not so great points - the blind didn't really exclude all of the light so I was woken early by the sun and the room was noisy, I use earplugs so slept OK. I don't usually bother with the breakfast at these places but it came with the rate this time. The cold stuff was OK and the hot stuff looked awful, I'd save your money and buy a much better breakfast at any of the cafes around the area. Obviously a good position, slap on the tube and mainline station and the surrounding area isn't bad. So, overall not a bad stay for the price (cheap in comparison to the other London hotels I use) but nothing to get excited about. To be fair, when I stayed previously I had a family room and it was much quieter and had better blinds. For a family on a budget to London it isn't a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: dmawson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time a couple of weeks ago for one night. I can only describe it as a Hotel from hell. On arrival the male receptionist was on his mobile chatting to presumably friends. He took no interest in my custom. The lift to the rooms was so dark it is a health and safety hazard. My room was hot. Air con unit was out of order. Impossible to open the window. Very stuffy and unpleasant. Only one pillow supplied in the room. When I asked the male receptionist for an extra pillow he said they had none spare! No telephone in the room. If you want to make a call you have to use your mobile. The tv has limited channels. Why there is no skynews and other freeview channels etc is beyond my understanding. Bathroom was dirty. Toilet flush handle was loose. Door handle on the bathroom door was loose. Light fittings next to the bed were all loose. The shower curtain was stained and smelly. Drainage was slow in the shower due to a blockage. Despite a do not disturb sign on the door the cleaner knocked on the door at 8am and 0915. I have emailed customer services about the above but have I received a reply? Short answer is no. Avoid this hotel from hell at all costs and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: RapidAssistant
Reviews.Content: Travelodges are much of a muchness really, and this one isn't any different. The overall strategy is clear - cost reduce everything in sight so that the core offering - a clean, and pleasant roof over your head is at a competitive price. And it is getting harder and harder to find a sub Â£100 room in a big name chain in this part of London anyway now that the Eurostar comes into St. Pancras - and as Premier Inn seems to be going further upmarket - their Euston branch across the road is now seldom under Â£110 a night now no matter when you try to book it seems. That just be my bad luck, so don't quote me on that figure! I paid Â£79 per night for three nights and this was the flexible rate - which is still cancel-able with no penalty. You can go cheaper if you go for the Saver, non-refundable, pay upfront rate, but on this occasion it only represented a Â£15 saving and really wasn't worth the risk. Location wise you cannot fault it - literally next door to Euston railway station, and a short 5 minute walk from St Pancras/King's Cross. Camden Town is a 15 minute walk away, and you can get a Tube to pretty much anywhere from Euston anyway. The real advantage it has is that it is one block back from the busy Euston Road, so noise isn't as big a problem as those hotels (the Premier Inn Euston for example) that are right on it. With regard to the room/experience itself - if easyJet or Ryanair did hotels, this would be what they'd look like! So there is no bath, just a shower. There are no complimentary toiletries (save for a tiny carbolic-like bar of soap) You get plastic cups instead of glass tumblers. El Cheapo tea and coffee. The decor is incredibly white and soulless. You have to ask for a second set of towels as they are not given to you automatically. There isn't even a phone to the concierge - which means you have to use your mobile to go via the Travelodge switchboard to phone the hotel from the outside. Wi-fi is chargeable. The bar only sells bottled beverages (at the time of writing they are going a good promotion on Peroni beer - 2 for Â£5 - useful given London pub prices!!). You are also encouraged to use the self-check in machine at the door - which for some reason allocated me a disabled room that I didn't ask for - I had to instead go through two members of staff before I found one that was willing to change it for a standard double. Quite frankly the bar/dining area (down in the basement) is tiny - so I'd imagine that they positively expect most guests not to go for the buffet breakfast, which says a lot for the likely quality of it. But I might be wrong of course.....I can recommend a good greasy spoon cafe on Eversholt Street about 3 minutes walk away! Overall then - a good hotel for the price paid.
