Yes, there were niggles - but it is perfect for those wanting to go cheap, but not risk getting your fingers burnt with one of the smaller independents in the area or one of those utterly dreadful tourist hotels around the Russell Square area (read my review on The President to see what I mean....). As I say, there is the Premier Inn across the road or the ibis Euston which I'd choose over this place if it was a like for like comparison on price. Good, but average.

Reviews.Title: “First time - last time.”
Reviews.Author: AndyC333
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed in a Travelodge before but being fairly well travelled I have slept in more than a few basic places. However, this place is really poor. As others have commented, the ground floor rooms are horrendously noisy being adjacent to a busy main road and the breakfast is minimalist continental. There is no storeroom for luggage so, after checking out by midday, if you are not leaving London until the evening you will have to pay a minimum of Â£8.50 per item to store your things at Euston Station. All in all, for a flying stopover-business-trip-type thing, it is tolerable. For a cheap weekend break, give it a miss and pay a little more somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it - excellent value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: teens1977
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights as part of a Superbreak deal and was not disappointed. I have stayed at a few travelodges in my time, so was prepared for a basic stay, however I felt the room we were allocated appeared to have more modern, than other Travelodge rooms I have stayed in. The location was excellent, approx 10-15 mins walk from Kings Cross station. Room was very clean, bed very comfortable and bathroom clean also, with a powerful shower. Our room was at the end of the corridor on the first floor and it was very peaceful. Staff were pleasant. Considering the cost of most hotels in the London area, this hotel appears to be great value for money and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very uncomfortable night- poorest hotel in the area (stayed in most)”
Reviews.Author: westdidsbury
Reviews.Content: We stay in London every month and always in the Euston area. This was one of the few hotels we hadnt stayed in. Facts of our stay below: No information provided at checkin- just "do you want the breakfast or not?" (not exactly a good sell) The room wasnt clean, dusty and long hairs in the bathroom. For Â£100 per night we had to manage with one towel and no soap or showergel of any kind. nothing! The bed was the most uncomfortable id slept on in years. we could feel the springs digging in all night. I was under the impression that Travelodge were similar in standard to Premier Inn (being similar prices) This is not what we found at all. Unless you get this VERY cheap or think a hotel is "just a place to sleep"- do yourself a favour and try the two nearby premier inns or the Novotel

Reviews.Title: “Frequent travelodger...”
Reviews.Author: Esseeoteetee
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many travelodges and I would like to think I am not a snob when it comes to hotels. However, in this hotel I was placed in a disabled room (though I didn't choose to include this in my room search) the room was on the lower ground floor. It was dark. The drain for the shower smelled disgusting. I had two single beds but each duvet rather bizarrely had a double duvet cover on it. It was just a depressing room. Stay here if you don't plan on doing anything in the room except sleep and ONLY if you get a very good price. Location was great however.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: grotbags89
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 3 friends, we booked two double rooms, the rooms were situated on the same corridor but not next to each other. Our rooms were on the ground floor and passers by can clearly see into the room. However there is a blind that blocks out all outside view but also makes the room very dark as the lights are quite dim. The room is very basic but was clean. The shower has plenty of room, supplied with small bar of soap. Bed was really soft and comfy. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful on reception, they couldn't have been nicer to us. Even though we were on the ground floor, felt quite safe and there is a keycard system after I think it was 10pm so only hotel guests can enter the building. The surrounding area was noisy but quite fair for London. There is a pub just a few metres away and Euston train station is literally on the doorstep but you cannot hear the noise from the trains. Lovely restaurant also nearby called Prezzo, incredibly tasty and relatively inexpensive. The station also provides all the usual Nando's, M&S, Uppercrust etc. These all shut earlyish on though and we could not find any open shops nearby at night. All in all a pleasant stay but the cost of the room is expensive for what it is, simply paying extra because its London.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Travelodge - one can't expect much.”
Reviews.Author: Genius12
Reviews.Content: Am used to staying in five star properties, but needed something very close to Euston for a night. The Travelodge Euston is a standard Travelodge - clean and with a bed and ensuite bathroom, and that's about it! The 'hotel' is very expensive for what it is (lacking amenities etc.) and the rooms tiny, dark and not particularly comfortable. The bathroom is awful, with tiny shower that sprays water all over the floor. The TV is located at an odd angle, meaning one can't comfortably watch it in bed. The breakfast is served in the basement and is very poor quality/selection. I would recommend the Hilton Euston for a good value 4 star (which is not by any means perfect itself, but far better and not significantly more expensive!).

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: JPCHESHIRE
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed are stay at this hotel, exactly what you would expect from a Travel Lodge and a great price. Rooms were extremly clean and equipped with all that you would expect. Continental breakfast offered plenty to eat, and bar area was pleasent. The hotel building was bright and clean and staff were both friendly and helpful. Location was excellent standing right outside Euston Station perfect. An excellent base for our weekend in London at a resonable price would reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: GN3
Reviews.Content: Apart from its location plus the polite and friendly staff the stay at this property was terrible. The room was minute, noisy, with a broken air conditioning unit and a window that did not open. (forcing us to move another room at 11.00 p.m.) It was hugely overpriced at Â£90.70 for a one night stay and this included a pitiful breakfast of last years cardboard croissants and a sad array of cereal. Bad decision and unless you are desperate don't do it!!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Marjatta2
Reviews.Content: We booked early (5 months in advance) 5 familyrooms for 15 persons (13 teenagers an 2 adults) on saver rate. We got 5 lowerground adjacent silent rooms. Rooms were clean and spacious and we did not need to change any room during the whole 6 days booking period. Reception service was excellent and breakfast was good. Location and price were outstanding. Well, there was something to desire: - Only one key/room â€“ own key card for every guest would be better because the corridor doors were locked. - More fresh air needed (better ventilation or possibility to open windows) I would book this hotel next time with pleasure and I would recommend this for anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting service, Grotty Dirty room”
Reviews.Author: Lcarter111
Reviews.Content: I know travelodge is a budget hotel but this place took the Mick, from arrival the staff were ignorant and rude they were not polite at check in when we tried to get to our room using the lift we were forced to wait as they were using the only working lift as a service lift bearing in mind we had our two young children with us after a long journey i just wanted to get to our room unfortunately once we reached our room that was the last place we wanted to be. The children's beds were not made up we were short one set of bedding which we asked a maid for who just grunted at us. I then stood in a wet patch in our room which I placed a towel on which subsequently turned brown. The carpet felt dirty there were stains around the floor we all had to keep our shoes on the entire stay. The plastic cups left out in the bathroom for us to use which were not sealed looked like they had been used they were dirty I then went to reception to complain when the receptionist finally turned up at the desk I informed her of the problem with the cups she barked at me to go downstairs and get my own from he bar and turned her back and walked away The list could go on broken bed, broken lights, flat pillows, noise I have trid to complain to travelodge several times via e mail and would love to speak to someone direct but they don't even have a customer services telephone number I'm not one to normally complain but I wouldn't like anyone else to have the same experience my family did. Stay in the premier inn at euston thats where we moved to and it was excellent in every way

Reviews.Title: “No Fun & Poor Value”
Reviews.Author: WYorksMetman
Reviews.Content: I booked this as a crash pad to sleep after evening meetings mainly on the basis of its closeness to the station. It was as expensive as a full service hotel and lacking in faciluties even by normal travel lodge standards. You check in with a machine and struggle through a jail type door into a small lobby. The room was clean but very spartan. Although a double it only had pillows for 1. No chance of sleep with multiple flashing red lights and a window blind narrower than the window to allow plenty of light in. Checkout by machine presumably so the staff dont get to deal with complaints. Avoid unless available very very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “good location, but much too basic, booked a Hotel not a youthhostle”
Reviews.Author: lexy_healer
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel for my parents coming over form Germany beginning June for three nights. Had previously stayed at the Travelodge in Sydney, Australia and as my experience there was positive, assumed that we'd get good honest, inexpensive accomodation in London too. Hotel was much too basic though. Starts when one enters the premises, very small reception! (even portered appartment buildings seem to keep more space for their porter) - and only one receptionist. Waited in cue quite a while (I guess had we know they would not ask for passports we could have used the Automatic Check-in Kiosk) Room was not tiny, but small and fitted out VERY basic, at least clean and tidy. My mum was pretty shocked that there was NO soap at all in the bathroom, no dispenser, no small piece of hand soap (Travelodge argue on their website that most people bring their own toiletries, but I have not met anyone yet that carries their own handsoap?!?!). Room was booked as a double room and there was only one towle in the room. The duvet, was quite thin. To their credit when asked for another blanket and a 2nd towel they came through friendly and quickly - which still did not get rid of the intial stench of stingyness. Travelodge is advertised as a budget Hotel, but they did e.g. charge GBP 100.00 for the Saturday night my parents stayed there. Most unsettling my parents found the experience of checking out. They had a late flight and had assumed that they'd be able to leave their luggage for a bit with reception. They were confronted with the reply that reception was not allowed to take luggage, but were told there is a luggage hold at Euston Station next door (GBP 8.00 per bag btw). I interpret it the way that instead of usuing enough room for a fully functioning reception, they rather built three more rooms to maximise profits. They may get away with itas London is so busy and expensive, but me or my family will surely not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: SUSAN053
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with my wife. Automated easy check in. The room was clean and tidy typical travel lodge. We stayed in room 207 on a Friday, Saturday and Sunday it was very noisy till the early hours and again early in the morning. It felt like the window was open. At times you could hear the traffic very loud. We should have probably asked to change rooms but didn't. Having said that we had a great time and only struggled to sleep one night. The continental breakfast was ok. But if I went again I would make sure I didn't have a room facing the station.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cheap, not far out”
Reviews.Author: mrsboop
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in may 2011 after cancelling a booking at kings royal scot. very close to euston station on a main road. do not let the location put you off, we stayed on the lower ground floor which is the basement but it still has windows and you can see the street above. really clean, furniture looked new just what you expect from a travelodge no worries about stopping here. i was a little worried as i had read some bad reports but it was really nice and clean. did not do the breakfast but loads of things close by if your on a budget like m and s and whsmiths which have regular prices not london inflated prices- tesco cheap as well if you find it cant remember where we saw one think it was close to oxford circus. even though you are close to a train station and on a main road and our room was close to the road i never heard a thing neither did my family. my head hit the pillow and i was fast asleep without the aid of any alcohol although the 6 hundred miles a day you walk probably helped. you can get a free iron and extra pillows towels and sheets staff are very friendly and helpful. you can put your luggage at euston station for Â£8.50 per item per day so of course everything went into one bag, this shuts at 11.00pm, this saves on carrying your stuff round all day with you plus we were leaving from euston anyway. there are closer places to stop but you pay the price will a travel card you can go on any tube or bus all day. the tube is very fast only a few stops to centre like oxford st. first time is always daunting but just ask after a couple of times its easy. hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Great for Central London on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: KazB79
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here on quite a few occasions due to the convenient location as I travel from the north to Euston and also use the Victoria Line on the underground. The rooms have always been clean and comfortable every time I've stayed there and typical of what you would expect of a Travelodge. The staff are very polite and check in is straight forward using the touch screen check in system. There is no left luggage facility and you have to pay Â£10 for early check in or late check out but this is clearly advised on the website at the time of booking (I've only ever booked online so not sure if these are made clear on telephone/in person bookings) If you get a room facing the road then don't expect to get a decent nights sleep as it is very noisy, however if you get a room on the other side of the hotel it is lovely and quiet. As previously stated I have used this hotel on numerous occasions and would not hesitate to book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would Rather Sleep on the Street”
Reviews.Author: bugatti22
Reviews.Content: Travelled to this hotel on the 11th May from Manchesterbfor avcharity cycle. Arrived at 10:30pm, hotel had no rooms, even though we booked 5 weeks in advance. I was told that they allocate the bookings for check-in based on first comes first served. Left 4 of us waiting with bikes til 1am in the morning, shocking service and disgusting policy.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Helking
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as it's within 5 minutes walking distance of the Koko club in Camden where we were seeing a band. The hotel is situated directly across from Euston mainline railway station, within walking distance of Bloomsbury, Covent Garden and Camden. Check in was very quick and the staff were helpful and friendly. The room was typical of most modern Travelodges, medium sized with a double bed, small hanging area, flat screen tv, and a desk area with tea and coffee making facilities. The bathroom was small with a shower, no bath. Both bedroom and bathroom were spotlessly clean and fresh and everything was in good working order. The bed was comfortable and plenty of towels were provided. The hotel is on a very busy road junction so rooms at the front could be noisy, however the room we had was on the ground floor at the rear of the hotel and was extremely quiet. One very tiny issue was the slightly low water pressure for the shower, other than that a very good experience for Â£50.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quiet Room Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MARLEYDover
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night and it only cost us Â£29! for two, its a 5 minute walk from St Pancras Station and around the corner from Euston Station. This hotel like all Travelodge's was perfect for a clean and comfortable budget stay, some of the reviews for this hotel are to critical, but our room was very quiet and not once did I hear the traffic! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wherever you look, something is faulty”
Reviews.Author: RedTinkerbell
Reviews.Content: Faults : 1. soft and v lumpy bed 2. broken lifts 3. Vending machines out of order 4 one towel supplied for 2 people 5. one electric plug socket broken in the room 6. air con / heating would not work 7 broken window handle 8 no seats in Reception area 9. Reception toilets were out of order I would not recommend this Hotel , spend an extra Â£10 - Â£15 for the Premier Inn round the corner

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: kat1978
Reviews.Content: Fanastic location opposite Euston station, I felt safe & secure as a solo traveller in London at all times. The receptionist was always friendly and helpful (even when I locked myself out of the room). The room itself was just what I needed. The bed was comfortable, the digital tv provided a good picture and I found I had everything I needed - towels, extra pillow, wardrobe space, good mirror, kettle. I was disappointed that you would have to pay (a lot) for wifi, but got a good 3G reception instead. I would certainly stay here again (though being central London prices I would wait for a deal).

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: ABWStockport
Reviews.Content: Easy check-in you do it yourself via a touch screen monitor. Rooms clean and simple although not enough pillows and the towels looked as though they had seen better days.You can't open the window. but room does have air-con. Great location right next to Euston station and no outside noise was heard, some guests were noisey but you can get that staying anywhere. In the reception there are two computers to surf the net Â£1 for 30 mins, there is a cafe / bar in the basement, you can get a continental breakfast for Â£5.40 and children eat free

Reviews.Title: “Great for singles out for shopping”
Reviews.Author: stephaniemxx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a random jaunt out to London. Just wanted to do a bit of shopping and see some of the major sights. As i was travelling aloine it was brilliant that the hotel was just around the corner from Euston station, I practically rolled off the train into bed. With the tube being so close to I had the ability to get everywhere quickily so for location you couldnt beat it. I was staying alone but got a double bed, I dont know if its standard. The room was small but it had everything you needed, it was very very clean and had coffee and tea making facilities. Hairdryer on request. Sheets where crisp and clean it was everything a solo traveller needed. I ahd breakfast in the morning, despite the lady working on recption the staff were welcoming and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms noisey and no shampoo!”
Reviews.Author: DavidSweeney
Reviews.Content: very small rooms. noisey, uncomfortable bed, too hot. poor towels - good things were - Â£72 a night in a good location for station as was travelling early in the mroning - otherwise don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “The worst bed in the world!”
Reviews.Author: fredsdad1962
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Euston Travelodge for one night and that was one too many! To say the room was small would be an understatement. It was the width of a double with 18 inches either side. The shower and bathroom were equally as small with the shower being lukewarm at best. The bed was probably the worst in the world! Imagine trying to sleep on a jelly with the cocktail sticks pushed into it, then you will have an idea of how bad this bed was. Our room was on the ground floor next to a busy junction with constatnt traffic noise throughout the night and thios combined with the jelly mattress meant a very pooor nights sleep was had by both of us. The staff were not interested in moving us to a quieter comfier room despite several requests, oh and don't try to check in 1 hour early. I was told it was not possible as our room wasn't ready but then miraculously it was ready if we paid Â£10. We went to the pub next door for an hour and spent Â£10 on food and drink and at least had something to show for it. Are there any good points about this "hotel"? Just the one, it was clean. We moved from here to the Hilton at Kensington and this showed how a hotel should be run.

Reviews.Title: “Good disabled access”
Reviews.Author: jaynie111
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in this hotel with my disabled mum - her wheelchair access room was in the basement to the rear of the hotel; I requested my room to also be at the rear after reading reviews about traffic noise on this site. Both rooms were perfectly fine and traffic noise wasn't a problem at the back of the hotel - it is a no-frills hotel, so take your own shampoo and hairdryer, but the cheapness of the hotel should easily offset that inconvenience. The breakfast buffet was great - loads of stuff for a fiver. My mum was really happy with the size of her disabled room - loads of space to move around in the wheelchair, and a large wetroom/shower space too. Couldn't work out if the bar did hot food or not, seemed to be conflicting info everywhere, but there is a wheelchair accessible pizza express five minutes down the road. All in all, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Jimmyatethecat
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, this hotel was the best value for money in the area. We were apprehensive about the quality but our fears were groundless. The reception staff were a bit wooden but helpful nonetheless. Room was bigger than we had expected, we booked a family room, it was the same price as a twin or double, probably got more space that way. Didn't bother with breakfast but friends did and said it was basic but good. Only complaint was that mattress was a bit flat. Would have no problem staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “SERIOUSLY NOISEY”
Reviews.Author: asdfgh1
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel for one night. i actually live 10 mins away from the hotel but booked it just to spend some time with my boyfriend away from home. i have lived right next to euston my whole life (23 years), my boyfriend has lived next to kings cross his whole life (24 years) so we are totally use to hearing noise all the time, sirens going 24/7, buses etc, but MY GOD THE NOISE AT THIS HOTEL WAS JUST UNBERABLE. we did not get a wink of sleep all night. the buses in and out of euston station were going right past our window all night. the hotel really need to do something about it, not sure what, but something needs to be done. on the plus side, the rooms were pretty clean, small but it is a travelodge. in comparison to other travelodges i have stayed in this is by far the cleanest and more 'up to date' travelodge becuase it was built quite recently. for me it was a NIGHTMARE, i was aware there would be noise but not the kind i had to deal with when i got there(and i can handle central london noise!!!) would i recommend it? Yes - to heavy sleepers who want a clean more 'up to date' travelodge. No - to light sleepers

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: rodent1976
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before on my own so I knew what to expect from this hotel but this time I took my 6 year old son. I was very lucky last time to have a room at the back of the hotel and therefore quiet but this time I had a room overlooking the road and it was quite noisy. You could hear traffic, sirens all night. Luckily my son sleeps very well so he didn't wake up at all either of the 2 nights we were there. I would request a back room if I stayed there again. The location of the hotel is very good as it is just across the road from the underground station and this is the main reason I book this hotel. The breakfast was great value as you get a child's breakfast free when paying for a adult and my son certainly got his money's worth!! I would definitely stay here again as Â£100 for 2 nights in London is very good value, especially in half term!

Reviews.Title: “They deliver what they primus”
Reviews.Author: KiW74
Reviews.Content: Travelodge promis a room, a good bed, a private bathroom and a continental breakfast, and that is exactly what you get. The price is reasonable and the cleanliness of the room makes the whole deal good value. The breakfast was even better than expected from a budget priced continental. And express check-in (self service) worked fine. Service was ok. The remote to my TV was missing, and I had to ask twice to get one. But other than that, nothing to remark regarding the servicelevel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Buddingtraveller83
Reviews.Content: From reading reviews i have some tips on how to make it a positive experience. Pros: 30 seconds from Euston station, nice area, near restaurants and bars. Ask for a quiet room not overlooking road. Room is quiet and I had a fantastic night sleep. Express check in for long queues Potential Cons: None for me but depends on what you like. Hotel bedrooms are clean but small but I was not bothered as I was there for one night. Heating worked but was not quite hot enough but Im warm blooded so didnt bother me. Bed not great but still managed to sleep on it. Overall, if you want a personal service with 5* luxury this isnt for you, but my course was at the Hilton in kensington!! and even that wasnt as good as other 5*'s. If you want a clean, convenient and does the job service, it is perfect and at Â£80 for the night is a good deal. Travel lodges in Liverpool and Manchester can cost that on some peak nights because i have paid it and had a shocking nights sleep! Its fine... go on!!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy! Could you sleep in a bus lane?”
Reviews.Author: GCracker
Reviews.Content: I was put into Room 11, a room on the ground floor right next to a busy bus lane. Every few seconds another huge noisy double decker bus would thunder past the window, mere feet from where I tried to sleep. I can not over stress this point too much-- the buses did not stop all night long. Quite possibly the worst nights sleep I ever had. The window blind didn't cover the window properly, the room smelled and orange peelings on the stairs were there for all four days of my stay but this is small beans when compared to the total lack of sleep I got. To rub salt into the wound, some drunk yobs hammered on all of the street side windows at 4.30am one night yelling 'WAKEY WAKEY'. The joke was on them, I was never asleep to begin with. For Â£100 a night this is a very very poor offering.

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping in the middle of Beirut”
Reviews.Author: tinap40
Reviews.Content: Basic but clean and great value for money. Stayed with a friend and our 2 young daughters for 2 nights. Had a room facing Euston Road the first night and managed about 1 hours sleep max - horns, sirens, buses outside the window all night and the double glazing was shockingly poor as we could hear people's footsteps out on the pavement. They moved us the next morning to a much quieter room and we had a blissful nights sleep. Moral of story - email ahead and ask for a room that does not face onto the street!

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel = Budget Quality”
Reviews.Author: Brian R
Reviews.Content: Great location in London & reasonably priced for London. Unfortunately the service was bad. The key card did not work everytime we left the hotel room. Had to be rest each time. Most of the time there was no one on the reception so we had to wait 10+ minutes ot get someone. We stayed on the ground flood, room was nice but the bed was not confortable & outside the hallway smelt damp. Wouldn'T be rushing back to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value but road noise a plenty”
Reviews.Author: MultiMoose
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Saturday 30th January with my wife and 2 children (aged 7 & 5) it cost just over Â£50 including continental buffet breakfast for all 4 of us which is brilliant value for London and is located just outside the entrance to Euston Train station so handy for that too. We were on the 3rd floor at the far end of the building in the corner room (possibly room 329 but not 100%) so unfortunately we had some road noise, it didn't bother me or the kids just wifey. The room did have a cracked sink (hairline crack) and they offered to move us when I notified the reception but as it was only a one nighter I was just concerned we might be blamed. Room was otherwise clean, warm and tidy, shower was powerful and hot. We had friends who had basement room B11 which was much quieter so if you can choose on arrival go for the basement. Breakfast was fine, fruit, cereals, yoghurt, toast, croissants etc and is served in the basement bar cafe area, prebooked it was Â£9 for all 4 of us, an absolute steal.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and very good!”
Reviews.Author: peanutdeb
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel despite the other reviews and found many of the issues described previously, easily resolved following a discussion with the helpful and friendly staff. I asked for a room on the third floor away from traffic noises and got a fabulous large room which was well heated and equipped. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tph4
Reviews.Content: As noted in previous reviews, This Travelodge is not the place to stay, large draught from window above childâ€™s bed not stopped by blinds. Not heating other than an electric heater, which could not be used if pull out bed is being used. Power cord too short and only power sockets were by the desktop.

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal, lousy service and late breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Stattobath
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bog standard business hotel, but takes the biscuit for cost cutting. No staff on check in desk (ring the bell style if problems with the automatic ticket machine that dispenses a room key). Didn't feel particularly secure - as noone on check in desk and you could literally walk in to ground floor and lower ground areas without keycard. My keycard was issued with a label that said B on it - with no signs to a B floor (the guy who emerged at the desk to deal with another problem directed me to go to Lower Ground - guess people complain about being put in a basement!). I struggled to find the hotel from Euston station. It was not on a map in the station, nor did my cabbie (with all his knowledge) know where it was [because there are lots of Travelodges around the area!]. The room itself was fine - nice big TV with plenty of channels, clean, your typical business hotel. LG still had a window. No sign of a telephone, or the possibility to set an alarm (thank goodness for my phone). No shower gel - which is pointed out on the website as a "people prefer to bring their own, so we're passing on a cost saving"... don't know what people they are talking about, and I don't see much of a cut in a Â£130 room fee coming from such a measure. Honestly, I brought shower gel just because I'd noticed this - but my guess is most end up buying it from a machine in the lobby. What a swindle! Slept really badly. Got up early to get to breakfast at 7am to take it leisurely - find a queue of 4. Someone is remonstrating with a cleaner who clearly isn't paid enough to care about serving the customers, but is more bothered that she can't clean the carpet outside the breakfast room. 10 minutes late, the door opens with not an apology but "I'm not quite finished yet, but I thought I'd let you in" - charming. Breakfast is simple - too simple. Muffins, cereal, toast. Why was it 10 minutes late? Is this really breakfast in London now? Checkout - still noone on the desk. Please do not roll this model out to other hotels... what exactly did I pay Â£130 for? Only if really desperate to stay close to Eurostar would I stay here.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Travelodge....”
Reviews.Author: JackWonderful
Reviews.Content: It's a Travelodge. It's a basic bed, a basic room and nothing more than a bar of soap in the bathroom. But it's clean, it's cheap and as long as you know what to expect for central London it's good value (at least for one night... any more than that might be a bit depressing). Benefits of the Euston Travelodge is that it has a cafe in the basement - but I didn't use it so can't comment on quality. Plenty of other places to eat in the immediate vicinity though - including an M&S Food store around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Its only redeeming feature is the cost.”
Reviews.Author: MrsCiv
Reviews.Content: Travelodge's strapline is "Everything you need and nothing you don't". Well, judging by the uncomfortable beds, drafty windows, and worst of all the lack of soundproofing, this hotel doesn't class sleep as something its customers need! Myself and three friends stayed in a family room. Both the double bed and the pull-out third bed were damnably uncomfortable, the pillows were so thin as to be useless, and there was a dreadful draft coming from the window. Not to mention, the sofa and pull-out bed were both stained, as was the floor, and breakfast is definitely not worth the extra charge! But, worse than that, the noise from the traffic outside was so loud you'd have thought the window was wide open, and the noise from the corridor and adjoining rooms was even louder. None of us slept much during out entire stay thanks to a combination of neighbours returning from a night clubbing in the early hours, the uncomfortable beds and the constant traffic noise. The TripAdvisor description of "no frills" is an understatement at best! Worth staying in ONLY if you can't afford anything better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, reasonable cost for central London”
Reviews.Author: ja9Southampton
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room some months back for New Years Eve and paid full flexible rate. We have stayed in a few Travelodges before so knew what to expect. Basic but clean room, helpful staff. We just needed a bed for the night which was conveniently located and we could get back to at 4am with no problem. Location was perfect, right outside Euston station with shops around and a 10 mins walk from KOKO in Camden. I had read reviews about the traffic noise so asked for and got a room on the 3rd floor at the rear so we had no problem with noise. Also it seems there was a problem with the heating reported on here before but it was fine when we stayed. We had no TV though and oddly the kettle had no lead, but the lead was supplied on request. We were not staying long so the lack of TV wasn't an issue for us. Bed (as usual in Travelodges) was too soft for us, wish they were as good as Premier Inn on this front. All in all though, we wanted a clean no frills place to crash on NYE in central London and that is what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Attitude and earplugs.”
Reviews.Author: JAT74L
Reviews.Content: Attempted to check in using the automated process in the lobby (a note was on top of the reception desk pointing to these). I tried and failed (probably because my company had booked through Inntel) so I went to the desk but there was no sign of life. I called out "Hello" and a man appeared from a backroom, pointed and said "use the machines". I replied "doesn't work" and all I got back was "name?". I was then handed a card and told "first floor" and that was it. He dissapeared back into his back office. The room was small, a bit tatty and the road noise was bad. The window blind also didn't keep the street light out. I didn't get much sleep. The room rate was Â£90. I would probably pay Â£30 to stay here and if I was forced to do so again I would take eyeshades and earplugs. The only positive I can think of for this hotel is it's location for Euston station. This was the only reason I chose it. I certainly will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - great location and value”
Reviews.Author: AngusAsh
Reviews.Content: Great location right outside Euston Station. Room slighlty noisy from traffic outside from early in the morning. No problems with the heating like others. This is just a typical Travelodge so don't expect anything special.

Reviews.Title: “Please fix the heating!”
Reviews.Author: TanithPanic
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Travelodge Euston, fearing the worst, having read the other reviews. Having seen how people have coped with the automated check-in, I decided to push my luck and ask the guy on the desk if I could check in with him instead. No problem. He just needed to see the e mail confirmation, and within seconds, I was given a key for a room on the ground floor - a real bonus as I'm a senior citizen and can't walk fast with a travel bag. The room was huge, and I liked the open plan idea... it means there's less chance of leaving essentials behind in drawers. Plenty of tea and coffee supplies, and a great location. As I'd arrived in the middle of all the snow and am not good on my feet, I needed to get a taxi from the door rather than find one outside. The guy on reception was great in fixing me up with one, and was very sweet and apologetic when I showed dismay that it'd be twenty minutes before one was free. (However, it still got me to my destination only 5 minutes late.) Maybe all the "unhelpful, grumpy" staff had been given time off for Christmas, but there was nothing wrong with the staff at all during my stay. The shower in the morning was a little too good, I could have stayed there longer but had to remember to be "green" and be as quick as I could. The one drawback.... the air conditioning was turned on full blast - I didn't actually realise this could be turned off until I got back from my concert later that evening - and there was no central heating as there is in other Travelodges, only a fan heater, which had to be plugged in. Though it gave off a decent heat, it meant sitting/standing near it to get warm. Fix the heating, Travelodge management, and you'll have a customer for a long time to come. And please, please leave the air conditioning off and let the guests decide whether they want it on or not, it's no joke in the middle of winter.

Reviews.Title: “It has gone down hill....”
Reviews.Author: CoffeeBlackpool
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this Travelodge and the last. You now HAVE to check in at a machine in reception which means you cannot ask for the quieter rooms at the back. The person at reception could best be described as miserable. In the past I have found the staff good. The room itself was clean but looking tatty, the mirror was cracked, the window vent missing which caused a draft, the sink tap broken and the bed was a joke. I know it is budget but they are obviously not spending any effort on the place now. If you can get a room for Â£19 go for it, if not then best avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Travelodge ever”
Reviews.Author: Debs_86
Reviews.Content: Travelled for work reasons and just needed somewhere to sleep for the night after a late train into St. Pancreas. Location is the only thing positive about this hotel, I of course knew what to expect at a travelodge as spent many nights at various travelodges throughout the country but this was in my opinion the worst I have ever been in! Check in was basic, the lady didn't really care about giving good customer service. We were on the ground floor and the corridor had a stale smell of smoke as did our room. Across from our room was a huge hole in the wall and not even an attempt to cover the hole temporarily. Like I said our room smelt of stale smoke but we were so tired just wanted to go to sleep. The mirror was cracked, and the room just felt tired! Our air con machine decided to constantly make a noise but luckily we were there exhausted it didn't stop us from sleeping, but could imagine it would really irritate other people! Also the traffic outside of the hotel is really noisy and near a fire station so constantly hearing emergency services driving by. Check out the same lady didn't really care or ask us if we had a nice stay so was very glad to leave this hotel...would never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “basic no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller028
Reviews.Content: had to pay an extra Â£10 to check in an hour before. put in room at front hotel but asked to be moved as far too noisy and heating not working. moved to quieter room but heating not working, seemed to be problem in hotel and was to be looked at. reception loaned us a heater and i asked for an extra duvet. heating finally fixed late at night but heating in our room still didnt work. as we had returned to hotel after a theatre trip and it was near 11.30 couldnt be bothered going to report to reception. breakfast not worth the money there are plenty of eateries in euston station which is across the road. if you want a basic hotel which is ideal for the mainlines and tube this hotel is ideal. reception staff were pleasant and helpful even though there were quite a few residents complaining about the heating, some were checking out and getting money back. we didnt bother as we didnt fancy wandering around in the cold looking for alternative accommodation and as husband has a knee injury walking too far wasnt an option. ask for a room at the back of the hotel (view non existent) but front of the hotel is so noisy. Still feel room rate overpriced Â£110 even though it is central london. would recommend hotel with a few reservations, dont book breakfast go to euston, ask for room at back of hotel. if you just want somewhere clean and central to put your head down this hotel will tick the boxes

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: suzshi
Reviews.Content: I really would not recommend you stay here. Yes, it's convenient for the staion but that is about the only positive I can think of. I arrived and tried to use the automated check in machines ... didn't work. Lady on reception just laughed and said they never work. She told me "we have a problem with our heating" ... yeah a quite major problem it turns out - No heating at all. Quite the understatement. Not fully understanding the state of affairs I took up her offer of an extra duvet, rather than being moved to Kings Cross as I was nervous of being in a different part of London than planned. So off I went to my room having been told the extra duvet was on its way. On the way to the room I passed an apparently kicked in portion of plaster board which made me wonder about the place. The room when entered, was ICY cold - not just a little chilly. There was wind coming in from the window despite it being apparently closed. I wish I'd had a thermometer with me, but it seriously felt as cold in the room as it had outside - bear in mind this is in the middle of this really cold spell in the UK (December 6th 2010). I attempted a bit of the old British spirit of coping and laughing in the face of discomfort, and wrapped myself in the duvet, contemplating what to do. I thought perhaps I could cope when the other duvet arrived. But no, after 20 minutes I went to reception to ask about the duvet - I was told it will be there in a minute ... another 30 minutes ... where is my duvet? This time they said he's upstairs he'll be down in a minute ... and when I said but didn't you say that 1/2 an hour ago they protested "really, he'll be there now". Yet another 30 minutes and finally what happens? Someone barges into my room ... looks shocked and apologises. He'd been told (only just if you believe him and not reception) to come and TAKE the duvet from my room to give it to a guest in a DIFFERENT room!! At this point, I got rather cross (to put it mildly), packed up what little I had unpacked in the igloo-like room, and stomped off to reception. I can think of one more positive thing about this hotel apart from the location and that is that I didn't have to argue much before they called me a taxi to Kings Cross Travelodge. By now it was midnight. So off I went with a rather surly taxi driver (not black cab) to Kings Cross. Kings Cross Travelodge is not perfect by any means (broken lights, grubby etc) but it had warmth and a bed, so thank goodness for that. They also provided a taxi back to the Euston hotel so I could get my bearings ... but that was only because I demanded it. To summarise, I would DEFINITELY not recommend anyone stay in the Euston Travelodge - they have no heating, don't warn you before you travel and don't properly explain the situation. The hotel is freezing and grubby and not well cared for. This totally spoilt my trip to London. Please avoid this hotel, and avoid my mistake of thinking a chain of budget hotels might not be luxurious but at least they'd have warm beds. In fact, I would recommend avoiding Travelodge completely.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs and no heating”
Reviews.Author: Mac2010_10
Reviews.Content: I arrived tired and went to my room...only to discover brown stains on the sheets. When I pulled open the covers, low and behold there was a party of bed bugs. I had a sampling kit with me and have taken them back to have analysed for identification. Then I was moved to another room, this time the heating was broken with freezing temperatures outside. No where else in London could I get a room. I stayed under the covers ( they did offer an extra duvet) then I got up to wander Euston and drink warm coffee and snacks..

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jean186534
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a weekend in London. When we arrived on Friday afternoon, we were issued with rooms on the main road, ground floor, where you could hear people talking outside on mobile phones. The main corridor of the ground floor stinks of cat urine and is worse first thing in the morning. The rooms are only barely a step up from your worst hostel. The beds were awful, broken springs etc. There is no phone in the room to call reception or indeed assistance if this was needed. We took in a show on Friday night and some of the group wanted a nightcap. The bar/"dining area" is tiny and there was no one using the facilities at 10.45pm. Bar staff member most unhelpful, rude and we clearly disturbed his TV viewing as he turned up the TV to a deafening volume to continue his viewing pleasure, whilst ignoring paying customers. We eventually gave up and left. Later that evening, there was a disturbance of a group of men returning from a night out who obviously were having a heated discussion, which resulted in one of them kicking a massive hole in wall outside our room. Being two lone females with no access to phone main desk for assitance this was a particularly scary and unsettling end to our evening. The heating in both rooms was problematic and the reception merely handed over a convector heater to our friends for their room, and didnt even check the heating panel etc or offer any further assistance. Given that it in minus degrees this was awful. There was poor poor quality of breakfast on offer, no cups, mugs, bread etc for basic tea/coffee or toast. Member of staff on duty said it was his first day and he didnt know what to do. Really - avoid this hotel, there are better quality "budget" hotels in the area but would neve use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: dechalk
Reviews.Content: Being greeted by a rude desk clerk who directed us to the automated check-in kiosk which didn't acknowledge our booking wasn't a good start, but things went significantly downhill from there! An insistence that the two receipts clearly stating "paid in full" did not mean we had already paid for the rooms and ened up extending the check-in process to about 2 hours. During this time, a refusal to ring the manager and constant attempts to serve other guests while not resolving our fairly major issue was especially annoying. We were told that we had to pay for the rooms a second time before we could check-in. After finally caving in and paying again, we heard other guests saying the heating was off in the hotel. We asked if this was correct ad the clerk confirmed that it was. We also asked for heaters but were informed that they did not have any. This seemed slightly worrying in london's worst winter for over 20 years and below freezing temperatures outside. We took to our twice paid for rooms and shivered the whole night through. In the morning, the breakfast staff threw our 2 day lunch passes in the bin and immediately threw pineapple on top of them, despite there still being another day when we needed them. He smirked when told of this. We reported the cold issue to reception again and were promised that the heating would be fixed soon. We left for the day and felt slightly warmer in the London snow than we had in the rooms the night before. When we returned 7 hours later, the heating wasn't fixed but we were promised portable heaters. We again went out and when we returned to go to turn in for the night, half of our rooms had heaters, the others were like large refrigerators. We again asked for additional heaters or some alternative and were told they would send a repair man. When he arrived, he removed a fuse, replaced it and said it should be ok now. It wasn't and when I reported it again, I was told the repair man had gone now and they couldn't do anything to help. I explained that this was now 2 consecutive nights in below freezing temperatures and I was informed that I could get a refund when the manager came in the next morning. Guess what? No refund but an email address to explain the problems and they would decide what should happen. If you want to pay too much, get sub standard accommodations, rude staff who would either lie to get rid of you or laugh at your predicament then stay here. But if you want to feel that you would not be better off sleeping on the streets and giving lots of money to the homeless then go somewhere else. Just please do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: staceyd316
Reviews.Content: Perfect for travellers as this is right next to Londons Euston train station which has great connections to all parts of london so it is easy to get anywhere on the tube. Nice big spacious room very clean. Downfall is that it is soooo noisy and the noise didnt stop through the night and also there were no spare pillows or blankets so it was a bit cold.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't want to stay for more than a night”
Reviews.Author: richcath1
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before but not for a year or two since Travelodge started to charge much higher prices for this Euston hotel. It's location is great for our requirements,being only a short walk to Camden and Fitzrovia. The rooms are clean,quite large for a budget hotel and contain most things you would expect.The shower room is really quite nice and the shower is warm & powerful.The towels are good. That's the upside.The downside is that every effort seems to have been made to make the rooms as joyless as possible.Dull paint scheme,thin,plain blind.Awful fake wood units etc.It could all be so much nicer. So there you have it.Not as nice as the Premier Inn over the road but the shower is better. Not as nice as the Ibis around the corner but a lot cheaper. You pays your money and takes your choice. Oh and one last tip.Don't use the machines to check in.They start by giving out the worst ground floor rooms right at the side of the road with 24 hour buses. OK for a night but could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Shambolic, glad we only had to stay one night”
Reviews.Author: stevie9398
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst Hotel I've every stayed at. Luckily we were just using it as a stop-over on the way back from Paris on the Eurostar and catching a train from Euston the next day. The hotel is very convenient to Euston Station but that's the only good point. Our room was a family room in the basement and was quite small. The bathroom was grotty, had a loose toilet seat and no bolt on the door. The double bed was OK but the pull out bed for our two children was dirty and we had to make that up ourselves. Breakfast was a shambles. It was advertised as an 'all you can eat' continental buffet. There were no bowls for cereal, no cups for coffee, no juice glasses and no knives. If you needed any of these you had to ask and the staff would go and find a cup or two for you. They appeared to be very disorganised. There were baskets and bowls set out for croissonts, pastries and fresh fruits but they were all empty! So I took cereal instead - and had to ask for milk to go with it! In the absence of anything else to eat people were choosing bread or toast but that ran out as well. Luckily we had to go as we had a train to catch. Naturally I wouldn't recommend anyone should stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid. It looks okay but details are all wrong.”
Reviews.Author: EpicCure
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Monday 22/11. Paid Â£102 and as the rooms look okay it seemed a bargain. We arrived and the room seemed fine. But: the mattress was very cheap and soft and very uncomfortable. the air conditioning made a very load high pitched squeak all night and the walls creaked. the window had an ill fitting blind that didn't keep the light out. we had an inner room but the road noise was loud and wasn't helped by the poor quality window that didn't insulate noise (It was very difficult to sleep in this room.) the floor seemed damp hairdryer had to be signed for at reception I wished I'd paid a bit more and gone to Premier Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs!!”
Reviews.Author: Kirstin81
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel at 9.30pm and were greeted by the unprofessional manager who was in the middle of still taking her coat off at the start of the shift (she was supposed to start at 9pm!) The first thing she did was ask us if we wanted to pay Â£1.50 to buy some stale cake or some sweets for children in need & looked pretty miffed when I politely declined... We were given our key for a room on the ground floor but had to go back to reception 3 times as the key didn't work. Eventually the so called manager came along to open it & we found it was a tiny double room. We said that we had booked a twin room & she said that that was the room we had been given and she couldn't do anything about it- I hadn't travelled to London to sepnd 2 nights in the same bed as my mum! Eventually after persistance she miraculously found a twin room for us- this was in the dungeons on the ground floor & was terrible. The bathroom was so smelly, beds were tiny (I didn't move all night as I thought I would fall out) heating didn't work & there were plastic drinking cups upside down on the toilet cistern - nice! I don't like having to complain but when you're paying 75 quid a night for a room it's just not good enough. My complaining fell on deaf ears though. The reception staff couldn't have been more rude or unprofessional about the whole thing. We were moved the next day 4 rooms along to right beside the bar which is open till 5am!! Another sleepless night. The hotel is in an excellent location for the underground and is a short walk from Kings Cross station, but other than that has nothing going for it.

Reviews.Title: “cheap only in off season..”
Reviews.Author: sauravdis
Reviews.Content: I had a mix feeling about staying here. I arrived around 23rd. in London and stayed here with my friend. the rooms were small but fine n clean but the bathrooms were a bit too small for my liking or my friends. Its a no frill hotel/lodge and we had to pay 75pounds around about for a night's stay which I totally loathed..Had I got the room for 19 pounds( the price they advertise at) I'd be glad to stay there then.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Wrxpc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night before catching the Eurostar to Paris. We found it to be very quiet and exactly what we wanted, a cheap night in a quiet hotel. The check in and check out process was easy, we had a nicemeal in a pub down the road, nothing to complain about. We had a room down the back and while it wasn't huge it was bigger than the Tunes Hotel in Kuala Lumpur we had stayed in the night before, and a lot quieter!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy & basic”
Reviews.Author: Solotrip
Reviews.Content: I had to pay an inflated Â£140pn due to the tube strike - all other nearby hotels were full. The room was basic but clean though the bedding looked worn. The road outside was VERY noisy & the reception couldn't move me as the hotel was full. Breakfast was in an underground windowless room with a dominant TV blaring - the food was un-appetising, I didn't bother the second day. I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible reception staff!!”
Reviews.Author: dotstar26
Reviews.Content: as we walked into the hotel the reception staff started laughing very loudly, they didnt say hello ...etc. the staff at the front desk were very rude and need more training in how to speak to guests. a lady infront of me wanted to make a complaint about her booking, but the receptionist informed her that there was no managers there and she'd have to complain online. the receptionist didnt apologise for the error in her booking. the room was fine, only complaint was that there were no phones in the room

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for rail traveller - good value”
Reviews.Author: DSG52
Reviews.Content: It's a Travel Lodge - they don't do frills - they do basic clean , comfortable , en suite rooms . Service is availabe if you ask . Prices range from cheap to good value depending on how you book - locations are mostly convenient for travellers . Euston is great for rail travel into/out of London - and is a budget price . Apart from being so close to main line stations it is also convenient for the west end - by bus straight down Marylebone Road (opposite) - short taxi journey - or easy walk . Selection of restaurants/pubs nearby - doubt it could be bettered on price . I use Travelodges extensively - they vary - but never had a bad stay yet . Especially if you can plan ahead they are fantastic value .

Reviews.Title: “Want a plug in your sink - change room ! But still excellent value ...”
Reviews.Author: PeterPan2
Reviews.Content: All excellent value for money as usual ... EXCEPT : when I checked in, there was no plug in the bathroom sink. Easy I thought - I'll just pop to reception and they're bound to be able to give me a plug (as on other occasions they have done with missing TV remote controls) ... But no, they said they didn't keep any spare plugs and that if I wanted a plug in my sink I'd need to change room - which they offered to do for me. Having already unpacked I was none too enthusiastic about changing room just to get a plug in my sink ! I appreciate that to keep prices down, costs need to be kept down too. But how on earth do Travelodge save money by not keeping a stock of plugs available behind reception - they're going to need to replace lost/stolen ones anyway ! But apart from that - excellent value for money as usual !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: peachiepagan
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay and will use this hotel when staying in London for leisure and business in future. Opposite euston station and only 2 mins walk from Kings Cross station so great location from both West and East coast railway lines. Clean spacious room ! I arrived at the hotel and use the express check in which was quick and efficient. I then entered my double room which was very large in size. There was a large desk, comfy double bed and LCD TV. There was Hot drink making facilities along with a small hanging space for clothes. The bathroom was clean as was all the linen. The only slight issue with my stay was the dissapointing water power of the shower which then leaked onto the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and nasty - AVOID”
Reviews.Author: toncek
Reviews.Content: I sometimes use Travelodges and generally find them a good low price option for a single night while traveling. AVOID THIS ONE. The room had not been cleaned properly - there were dirty cup marks all over the table. The bathroom fittings looked as if they were about to expire and the taps were leaking badly. The window could not be closed as the handle had been removed. I brought all this to the attention of the recpetion - they did nothing. Finally, breakfast was not the usual Travelodge standard - nothing hot, no croissants, just a coffe tea maching and make your own toast. DISGRACEFUL. I contacted Travelodge but they declined to respond.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Central London”
Reviews.Author: Copjunk2
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a Thursday night in Room 318. Check in was quick via self service terminal. Room was on 3rd floor facing onto Grafton Place, you could hear sirens - but you are in central London so it is to be expected. Room and bathroom were very clean, and althougth the room was not huge it more than adequate for a one night stay. Yes it is difficult to watch the wall mounted tv lying in bed, but I found using the chair with a pillow behind me next to the end of the bed, with my legs resting on the bed was a good alternative. The room is typical new style Travelodge so not much space for storing clothes apart from hang space. Don't bank on getting something to eat in the cafe bar - wasn't a great selection, mainly pizza - I ended up going to get something from M&S Simply Food which is just across the road. I heard no noise from within the hotel during the night. Breakfast was pretty good for the money - cereal, yoghurt, fruit, pastries, toast etc - server was friendly and pleasant and everything was avaliable when I went at 8am. There are not a lot of tables so you may have to sit on a stool at the breakfast bar which goes around the room. Internet access (Â£1 for 20 mins) is available in reception along with vending machines selling non-alchoholic drinks, sweets, crisps and toiletries. Overall if you can get this Travelodge on a saver deal I would say it is excellent value for money. Even paying Â£90 as I did on business was still pretty good for central London.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry About That”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaandMick
Reviews.Content: I am now sick of the Hotels I will never stay in another one. We stayed in this so called helpful Travel Lodge for four nights this month (Sep) and I was sick of hearing the staff say â€œsorry about thatâ€� Travel Lodge, just like any other Hotel, is interested in one thing, and one thing only, profit no matter what. I thought you could not get blood out of a stone, but I am sure Travel Lodge knows how. The stay We arrived about one hour before the booking in time. We were told if we book in early we would have to pay an extra Â£10. At first I said â€œno wayâ€� I said â€œwe will sit here till the booking time of 3pm. Then I realised there was no seating or waiting area, and we could not walk round as we have luggage, so we had to pay the extra Â£10, this was charged even though the room was ready. That was the start. Day Two We went down for the continental breakfast that was Â£5.25 each. We paid then looked at what we could choose. There was empty baskets one basket with left over fruit and brown bread and serials. I asked what should be in the empty baskets and was told that chioce had all gone, I asked then for white bread, again I was told it had all gone. I then asked why I was left with left overâ€™s and not the same choice as everyone else, I was told because others have had too much. I then asked why they took my money knowing there was nothing left they said "sorry about that" and I asked for my money back. I was then told they can not give refunds in cash only on a card. When I said I have just paid in cash I was told it does not make any difference. "Sorry about that" Day three; We got back from a day out to find our clean towels, or should have been, we opened one out to find a great big brown stain, I will leave that to your own imagination. We herd that saying again â€œsorry about thatâ€� The last night. We were in bed when we herd someone trying to get in to the room, I shouted â€œwhat do you wantâ€� ten minutes after the same thing, so I got out of bed opened the door to find no one around. I got back in bed and ten minutes someone tried to get in again. This time I jumped out of bed and opened the door and found two of the staff trying to get in with a key card. When I asked what was the reason I was told according to their system we should have checked out and the room should be vacant, then again came â€œsorry about thatâ€� On our departure we handed in the key card and was asked if all was well so we explained and guess what we were told? â€œSorry about thatâ€� Even the room we stayed in was hell. The noise was out of this world, the worst you could imagine. The blind would not cover the window to stop people looking in. When the blind was down people could see through the gap straight in to your bed. The toilet seat was loose. I was going to complain, but I just could not risk being told again â€œSorry about thatâ€� So in my opinion when you stay at this lodge you do so at your own risk. I have compared this lodge with a homeless person and the aggravation they get. A homeless person could have dirty towels, just like the lodge. A homeless person tries to sleep in the street with lots of noise, just like the lodge. A homeless person will eat scraps for breakfast, just like the lodge. A homeless person will be expected to move on, just like the lodge. The only difference is that the homeless person got for free what we paid a lot of money for. People who say they had a satisfactory stay here are either satisfied with anything or were very, very lucky. If the owners of the Travel Lodge are reading this and do not like it, there is just one thing I can say â€œSorry about thatâ€�

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: CarlisleSue
Reviews.Content: I was due to arrive into Euston at 10.30 at night for a meeting the following day. The room was pre-booked by my company and paid for by credit card. I telephoned the hotel in the morning to confirm.Arrived at the hotel they told me they had let the room as it is their policy to overbook rooms. No apology, no alternative, very scarey indeed. Ended up at midnight on a friends floof as all the hotels were full. I will never use Travelodge again. I was appalled by my treatment. There were 3 other people I met also treated the same

Reviews.Title: “On two occasions, the maid attepted to...”
Reviews.Author: Planet_Paul
Reviews.Content: On two occasions, the maid attepted to enter our room whilst the do not disturb sign was on the door and well before 12 noon check out. Also, the receptionist moaned at my wife when we requested a hair dryer, which was advertised as being available from the reception desk at the hotel. Otherwise the hotel is clean and in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: RCK09
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night as catching the eurostar early the next day and was great for this purpose. 10 min walk to st pancreas... Check in was fine. although I had asked for a quiet room and been allocated one on the main road and with young children I wasnt happy with this but reception were very friendly and happy to change us to the basement. (although this meant we ended up having to collapse and take the travel cot to our new room) but this was a small price in my eyes to get a lovely quiet room. Room modern, clean and new tv. Paid Â£29 so great value for money and a bargain for central london.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap option if you have a early Eurostar train to catch”
Reviews.Author: CDM52
Reviews.Content: Hotel is next to Euston station but a short distance away from the busy Euston Road - inside it was quiet. Check in was automated - but was well designed and simple to use. New hotel. Room was smaller than standard Travelodges I have used elsewhere but comfortable for a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “top hotel couldnt fault”
Reviews.Author: gezzer30
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while i went to a concert in london, and I couldnt fault the hotel one bit. The check in service was all done by machine which was very straight forward to do. The room was very nice, clean and tidy. There was also a flat screen tv in the room. The hotel was right across the road from the station. Overall I was very statisfied with here, and would stay here again and recommend here to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and staff”
Reviews.Author: RedKatie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night at the end of August before heading off on holiday in Europe. I love Travelodge. It is such good value. The rooms are a good size, especially the family rooms, and if you want to have breadfast in bed and relax you can do so. The rooms are clean and have all that you need. If you need anything extra you just ask. But what made the stay for me was the staff. They were really helpful and friendly. I didn't like the room that I was allocated at first so I went to reception and asked if I could change. No problem and all done charmingly. Over and above all that though was how they helped out with a coat problem. I had planned to leave my heavy coat with a dry cleaner for a week but they were shut (bank holiday). I asked Travelodge if they could keep it for me and they said it was no problem, and there was no charge. I really hadn't expected a budget hotel to have this level of service so was delighted. I returned a week later and my coat was waiting for me. All this done with charm and grace. And I don't think it's just this Travelodge. I stayed at the Croydon one on my return and they were lovely too. I've stayed at a few Travelodges over the last few years and they have all been excellent value. I don't think you can go wrong with them.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: barker813
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night trip to London with our 3 children the hotel is ideally located just round the corner from Euston Station, the family room as plenty big enough the beds were comfy the bathroom was clean a flat screen tv on the wall basically all you could need in a hotel. The reception staff were very helpful, the only faults i can say is the room where the breakfast is served is so small really not big enough at all there was 1 poor guy working on his own in there trying to keep everything stocked up, secondly the rooms were so noisey as its on a main road i could of asked for the room to be changed but to be honest i couldnt be bothered to pack again with 3 kids and move rooms the noise didnt bother my children or hubby just me as im a light sleeper but it was ok. We would definatley stay here again next time we visit london but i will ask for a quiet room next time i would think round the back would be better although the kids loved watching all the people coming and going out of the station. so all in all a very good hotel especially for the price

Reviews.Title: “Not family friendly”
Reviews.Author: scott1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights for a family leisure break in London and chose the hotel being near Kings Cross and the zoo as with a 4mth old baby and preschooler we didnt want to go on the tube too much. We arrived early evening and used the automatic check in to get our key, this didnt work so then waited for someone to come to reception desk. A girl eventually came and dumped a key on the desk then went off again, so we guessed the location of our room ourselves. Our room was fine for the price we paid we werent expecting great luxury. The room was in the basement and rather muggy so we put the air con on and went out for tea. On return from dinner we got back to the room and it was stifling! The air con, reading 18 degrees was pumping out very hot air. My husband went and managed to find a maintenance chap who agreed that it wasnt safe to sleep in there with two young children so told my husband to report to reception to get a new room. At reception the girl on the desk was extremely unfriendly. When my husband explained the problem she asked why we had put the air con on in the first place (it was summer?) and then just suggested we open the small window. Now bearing in mind we were at traffic level in the heart of london I wasnt keen on this and didnt believe it would make a difference seeing as how the room was scorching. Eventually the girl gave us new rooms as they had run out of family rooms (although the hotel was deadly quiet). So we spent the first night of our family trip with my huysband in one room with our eldest and me in another room with our youngest, with no phones in the room to talk to each other or reception and no tv remote in my room, it wasnt the most amazing night ive had. We didnt appreciate having to lug our luggage and two very sleepy girls around the hotel at way past their bedtime. On our 2nd night they moved us again, this time into a family room with working air con, and aside from the many people on the buses that passed outside being right next to our window (and so either had a very dark room with curtaain perm shut or felt like we were on display at the zoo) the room was fine. Having said this the toilets in this hotel are extremely dangerous. Of the three rooms I had all 3 toilets in the bathrooms had really loose seats and i can see someone esp younger children hurting themselves. It goes without saying we wont use this hotel again there are others in the same price bracket where you get that bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Dubious cleanliness, smelly, uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Bykergyal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my mum. Booked on line - but called before to check that they had family rooms, they said all of their rooms had pull out beds. Oh no they don't. Turned up and they only had rooms with one double bed. So had to sleep in same bed as mum. The mattress of the bed is SO thin you can feel the springs and the bed base through the mattress. The Carpet looks filthy. You couldn't open the windows, so the air was not clean and I felt ill after my stay. The hallway is very narrow, so much so that you can smell the other guests rooms as you walked by them. It is noisy - however my mum snored so loud that was the least of my problems. Totally understand that you get what you pay for - however I suggest you spend a few pounds more and go to the premier inn 200 meters away or the Hilton across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless and staffless”
Reviews.Author: Dallas2Raleigh
Reviews.Content: I never saw a single member of staff whilst I was at the Travelodge Euston, check in and check out was automated. This is a shame because I would have liked a room on a higher floor to get away from the incredible noise from Eversholt Street all night long. The window was open when I arrived so I closed it for security but arriving back after a night out it was open again. It transpired the window was broken and with no staff available I couldn't complain. This also stopped me from sleeping as being on the first floor with a broken window in central London did not make me feel safe. The location is very good and the public transport options are excellent with a range of buses and 3 Underground stations within walking distance. I really only chose to stay here because of a discounted online deal, otherwise I would have probably stayed at the Novotel a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a one night stopover”
Reviews.Author: danco28
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for St Pancras station and a short walk to Russell Square. Rooms are adequate but the hotel is indeed next to a very busy and noisy road (the double glazing doesn't help much with this either). The rooms are adequate, but fairly basic. It's OK for a one night stay and good value if you book in advance but I'd certainly not recommend spending a holiday in London at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good value when booked in advance”
Reviews.Author: MatttBirmingh
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel. The hotel is basic, and surprisingly badly maintained given that it is only 18 months or so old. Despite this, the rooms are functional and acceptably clean. The hotel is great as a stopping off point en-route, but would not make a good base for a longer stay. I booked the room on a 'saver' rate, making it excellent value for London but the hotel is almost certainly not worth the 'standard' on-the-day rate.

Reviews.Title: “I would NOT recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HM74
Reviews.Content: I have never been motivated to review a hotel before, but the travel lodge in Euston has achieved this. I know it is difficult to get a good hotel at a reasonable price in this city, but I cant recommend this place. It cost me about Â£170 (stg), for which I got a room on the ground floor (complete with such street theatre as vomiting man at night, man rowing with partner on phone at night and traffic chaos from 5.30 am). The rooms are spartan, but clean, but sadly lacking in things which you might be expected to take for granted: an iron (I was on a business trip) shampoo, or a phone even. They did have a bottle opener, which maybe is an indication of what they are aiming for. My bath towel had some sort of brown stain on it and the wall was discoloured. They were actually overbooked (the chap on the desk explained to someone that they tend to overbook, although in this instance it seemed to leave someone standing around at 11pm wondering if they would get a room somewhere else. I had to pay an extra Â£10 to check in early, which I understand is their policy, but seems to be a little cynical, considering the price I had paid for the room. So, in short I would urge people to avoid this place; it seems to adopt a RyanAir style attitude, which is not what the hospitality trade is meant to be about. I can't say whether it is indicative of the TravelLodge chain generally though.

Reviews.Title: “5 night stay for course”
Reviews.Author: DavePlym121
Reviews.Content: In an alright location, not as clean as u would wish, and just been woke up at 11:30 by a stranger that got key'd the wrong room number, my misses broke down in tears she was so scared.
